title: PLAZA / WORKING CLASS WOMAN
description: [Aimée.] A dialogue with a woman who has a job. And a husband. And kids.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still search..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still searching for a book, her eyes wandering over the colourful grid of softcovers.
dialogueTree.polish: „Hmm... Hmm... Hmm” – wciąż szuka książki, błądząc wzrokiem po kolorowej mozaice miękkich okładek.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Хм... Хм... Хм" – усё яшчэ шукае кнігу, блукаючы позіркам па каляровай мазаіцы мяккіх вокладак.

links.title: You: ""Protect and serve, madam! I found..."
links.english: "Protect and serve, madam! I found your husband."
links.polish: „Służyć i chronić, proszę pani! Znalazłem pani męża”.
links.belarusian: "Служыць і абараняць, спадарыня! Я знайшоў вашага мужа".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""God damn it, I already told you --..."
links.english: "God damn it, I already told you -- my husband isn't missing!" She crosses her arms.
links.polish: „Na litość boską, przecież już mówiłam, że mój mąż nie zaginął!” – zakłada ręce na piersiach.
links.belarusian: "На Бога, я ж ужо казала, што мой муж не знік!" – складвае рукі на грудзях.

links.title: You: ""But you said you didn't know where..."
links.english: "But you said you didn't know where he was."
links.polish: „Ale mówiła pani, że nie wie pani, gdzie on jest”.
links.belarusian: "Але вы казалі, што не ведаеце, дзе ён".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""And I specifically added that I di..."
links.english: "And I specifically added that I didn't *need* to know where he was."
links.polish: „Wyraźnie też dodałam, że *nie chcę* wiedzieć, gdzie jest”.
links.belarusian: "Я выразна таксама дадала, што *не хачу* ведаць, дзе ён знаходзіцца".

links.title: You: ""Well, I found him nevertheless. I'..."
links.english: "Well, I found him nevertheless. I'm Dick Mullen."
links.polish: „No, tak czy inaczej go znalazłem. Jestem Dickiem Mullenem”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, так ці інакш я яго знайшоў. Я Дзік Мулен".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Very well, then. Where is he?" She..."
links.english: "Very well, then. Where is he?" She's getting impatient, her hands now picking on a random book cover.
links.polish: „No dobrze. Gdzie on jest?” – zaczyna się niecierpliwić. Jej dłonie błądzą po losowych okładkach książek.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Дзе ён?" – пачынае нецярплівасць. Яе рукі блукаюць па выпадковых вокладках кніг.

links.title: You: ""There." (Point to the working clas..."
links.english: "There." (Point to the working class drunk down near the sea.)
links.polish: „Tam”. (Wskaż na pijanego robotnika nieopodal morza).
links.belarusian: "Там". (Пакажыце на п'янага рабочага недалёка ад мора).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Excuse me?!" She blinks. "I don't..."
links.english: "Excuse me?!" She blinks. "I don't follow."
links.polish: „Słucham?!” – pyta, mrugając. „Nic z tego nie rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Слухаю?!" — пытае, міргаючы. "Нічога з гэтага не разумею".

links.title: Empathy: "There's something else hiding in he..."
links.english: There's something else hiding in her voice though -- a trace of worry.
links.polish: W jej głosie kryje się jednak coś jeszcze. Odrobina troski.
links.belarusian: Аднак у яе голасе хаваецца яшчэ нешта. Крыху клопату.

links.title: You: ""I found a working class drunk and..."
links.english: "I found a working class drunk and I thought he might be yours."
links.polish: „Znalazłem pijaka z klasy robotniczej i pomyślałem, że może to pani mąż”.
links.belarusian: "Я знайшоў п'яніцу з рабочага класа і падумаў, што можа гэта ваш муж".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Right, 'cause working class women..."
links.english: "Right, 'cause working class women come with alcoholic husbands." She glances over your shoulder towards the drunk. "You know what?"
links.polish: „No tak, bo każda przedstawicielka klasy robotniczej ma męża alkoholika”. Zerka przez twoje ramię w kierunku pijaka. „I wie pan co?”
links.belarusian: "Ну так, бо кожная прадстаўніца рабочага класа мае мужа-алкаголіка". Пазірае праз ваша плячо ў бок п'яніцы. "І ведаеце што?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Remember, about that *what* -- neve..."
links.english: Remember, about that *what* -- never-ever say *what*.
links.polish: Pamiętaj – kiedy pytają o *co*, nigdy nie odpowiadaj *co*.
links.belarusian: Памятай – калі пытаюцца пра *што*, ніколі не адказвай *што*.

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""You were right. I do have an alcoh..."
links.english: "You were right. I do have an alcoholic husband. Although not that one."
links.polish: „Masz rację. Mam męża alkoholika. Ale to nie ten”.
links.belarusian: "Ты маеш рацыю. У мяне муж алкаголік. Але гэта не гэты".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Hah! Blam! Knew it."
links.english: Hah! Blam! Knew it.
links.polish: Ha! Bang! Wiadomo było.
links.belarusian: Ха! Банг! Было вядома.

links.title: You: ""But you told me your husband's all..."
links.english: "But you told me your husband's all right."
links.polish: „Ale mówiła pani, że z pani mężem wszystko jest dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Але вы казалі, што з вашым мужам усё добра".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I did and he is." She takes a step..."
links.english: "I did and he is." She takes a step back. "He's also an alcoholic."
links.polish: „Tak mówiłam i taki jest” – robi krok w tył. „Jest też alkoholikiem”.
links.belarusian: "Так казала і так ёсць" – робіць крок назад. "Ён таксама алкаголік".

links.title: You: ""But didn't you say your husband wa..."
links.english: "But didn't you say your husband was kind and helpful?"
links.polish: „Ale mówiła pani przecież, że pani mąż jest dobry i pomocny”.
links.belarusian: "Але ж вы казалі, што ваш муж добры і ўважлівы".

links.title: You: ""So is he missing as well?""
links.english: "So is he missing as well?"
links.polish: „Czyli on też zaginął?”
links.belarusian: "Дык ён таксама знік?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, he's not. Or maybe he is, I do..."
links.english: "No, he's not. Or maybe he is, I don't know. He's probably in the park, or in Jamrock somewhere. Drinking with his *friends*." She looks away.
links.polish: „Nie, nie zaginął. A może i zaginął, nie wiem. Jest pewnie w parku albo gdzieś w Jamrock. Chleje ze swoimi *kumplami*” – odwraca wzrok.
links.belarusian: "Не, не знік. А можа і знік, не ведаю. Напэўна, ён у парку або недзе ў Джамроку. П’е са сваімі *сябрамі*", — адвярнула погляд.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I haven't seen him for... Well, to..."
links.english: "I haven't seen him for... Well, to hell with him!" She has completely forgotten about her books, staring blank into the distance instead.
links.polish: „Nie widziałam go od... Do diabła z nim!” – zupełnie zapomniała o swoich książkach i wpatruje się tępym wzrokiem w dal.
links.belarusian: "Яго не бачыла ад... Д'ябал з ім!" — зусім забылася пра свае кнігі і пільна глядзіць у далячынь тупым позіркам.

links.title: Empathy: "There. She's worried now."
links.english: There. She's worried now.
links.polish: Proszę bardzo. Zaczęła się martwić.
links.belarusian: Калі ласка. Яна пачала турбавацца.

links.title: You: ""Kim, is it just me or do we have a..."
links.english: "Kim, is it just me or do we have a missing person's case here?"
links.polish: „Kim, wydaje mi się czy mamy tu do czynienia z zaginięciem?”
links.belarusian: "Кім, мне здаецца, ці маем мы справу з знікненнем?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't be so sure," he replies..."
links.english: "I wouldn't be so sure," he replies, before turning to face the working class woman.
links.polish: „Nie byłbym tego taki pewien” – odpowiada, po czym przenosi spojrzenie na kobietę z klasy robotniczej.
links.belarusian: "Я б у гэтым не быў так упэўнены", — адказвае ён, пасля чаго пераводзіць погляд на жанчыну з рабочага класа.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ma'am, just to be completely clear..."
links.english: "Ma'am, just to be completely clear -- do you want to report it to the police?"
links.polish: „Proszę pani, chciałbym się upewnić – czy chce pani zgłosić zaginięcie męża?”
links.belarusian: "Спадарыня, я хацеў бы пераканацца – ці хочаце вы заявіць пра знікненне мужа?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Report what? He's just out, drinki..."
links.english: "Report what? He's just out, drinking with his friends... I'm sure the police has better things to do than to chase down local goofballs."
links.polish: „Co miałabym zgłaszać? Po prostu pije gdzieś z kumplami... Policja na pewno ma ważniejsze sprawy na głowie, niż uganianie się za miejscowymi przygłupami”.
links.belarusian: "Што мне паведамляць? Проста дзесьці п'е з сябрамі... У паліцыі напэўна ёсць больш важныя справы, чым кідацца за мясцовымі дураньямі".

links.title: You: ""Not at all! The RCM is ready to ch..."
links.english: "Not at all! The RCM is ready to chase down every goofball in town. We care about you!"
links.polish: „Ależ skąd! MOR jest gotów odszukać każdego gamonia w mieście. Troszczymy się o państwa!”
links.belarusian: "Але ж адкуль! РГМ гатовы адшукаць кожнага нядбалага ў горадзе. Мы клапоцімся пра вас!"

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I just think missing per..."
links.english: "Honestly, I just think missing persons cases are mysterious."
links.polish: „Szczerze, to uważam po prostu zaginięcia za tajemnicze sprawy”.
links.belarusian: "Шчыра кажучы, я проста лічу знікненні таямнічымі справамі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're not all they're cracked up..."
links.english: "They're not all they're cracked up to be, officer."
links.polish: „Nie wszystkie są tak ekscytujące, oficerze”.
links.belarusian: "Не ўсе такія захапляльныя, афіцэр".

links.title: Logic: "He's right. Missing person cases mo..."
links.english: He's right. Missing person cases most often involve runaway teenagers or demented old people. The victims usually turn up by themselves after a day or two spent missing. There's not much searching to do.
links.polish: Ma rację. Zaginięcia dotyczą zwykle nastolatków na gigancie i starców z demencją. Dzień czy dwa po zniknięciu powracają zwykle sami. Niewiele jest przy tym szukania.
links.belarusian: Ён мае рацыю. Знікненні звычайна тычацца падлеткаў, якія ўцяклі, і старых з дэмэнцыяй. Дзень ці два пасля знікнення яны звычайна вяртаюцца самі. Шмат пошукаў пры гэтым не патрабуецца.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I get it. They're kinda bori..."
links.english: "Okay, I get it. They're kinda boring, right? Because eventually everyone returns home on their own."
links.polish: „Dobra, rozumiem. Są raczej nudne, nie? Bo koniec końców, każdy wraca samodzielnie do domu”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, разумею. Яны даволі сумныя, не так? Бо ў рэшце рэшт, кожны самастойна вяртаецца дадому".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or they don't -- and you'll never..."
links.english: "Or they don't -- and you'll never find them," he adds with a flash of teeth.
links.polish: „Albo nie wraca – i nigdy się nie odnajduje” – dodaje, błyskając zębami.
links.belarusian: "Ці ён не вяртаецца — і ніколі не знойдзецца", — дадае, бліскаючы зубамі.

links.title: You: ""But isn't *that* mysterious?""
links.english: "But isn't *that* mysterious?"
links.polish: „Ale czy *to* nie jest tajemnicze?”
links.belarusian: "А ці не з'яўляецца *гэта* загадкавым?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'd say there's nothing mysterious..."
links.english: "I'd say there's nothing mysterious about incompleteness. It's in fact rather unpleasant."
links.polish: „Według mnie nie ma nic tajemniczego w niekompletności. To raczej nieprzyjemne”.
links.belarusian: "На маю думку, няма нічога таямнічага ў няпоўнасці. Гэта хутчэй непрыемна".

links.title: Inland Empire: "You're wrong there. Incompleteness..."
links.english: You're wrong there. Incompleteness is the essence of mystery.
links.polish: Bynajmniej. Niekompletność to esencja tajemniczości.
links.belarusian: Няўжо. Няпоўнасць — гэта сутнасць таямнічасці.

links.title: You: ""Well, I still want one. I want a m..."
links.english: "Well, I still want one. I want a missing person's case!"
links.polish: „Dobrze, ale i tak chcę się tym zająć. Domagam się sprawy związanej z zaginięciem!”
links.belarusian: "Добра, але ўсё роўна хачу гэтым заняцца. Настойваю на справе, звязанай з знікненнем!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All right then..." He sighs. "He h..."
links.english: "All right then..." He sighs. "He has *questions* now."
links.polish: „W porządku...” – wzdycha. „Kolega ma do pani *pytania*”.
links.belarusian: "У парадку..." — уздыхае. "Калега мае да вас *пытанні*".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What kind of questions?""
links.english: "What kind of questions?"
links.polish: „Jakie pytania?”
links.belarusian: "Якія пытанні?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, I don't want it. Let's move..."
links.english: "Okay, I don't want it. Let's move on." (Don't take the case.)
links.polish: „Dobra, nie chcę się tym zajmować. Ruszajmy dalej”. (Nie przyjmuj sprawy).
links.belarusian: "Добра, я не хачу гэтым займацца. Пойдзем далей". (Не прымаць справы).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Great, let's do it.""
links.english: "Great, let's do it."
links.polish: „Świetnie, tak zróbmy”.
links.belarusian: "Цудоўна, так і зробім".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The working class woman doesn't say..."
links.english: The working class woman doesn't say anything, her eyes still fixed on something invisible in the distance. Some seagulls fly over her head.
links.polish: Kobieta z klasy robotniczej nic nie mówi – jej wzrok jest utkwiony w czymś niewidzialnym w oddali. Nad jej głową przelatują mewy.
links.belarusian: Жанчына з працоўнага класа нічога не кажа – яе позірк скіраваны на нешта нябачнае ўдалечыні. Над яе галавой пралятаюць чайкі.

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.english: "Why not?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because people either show up on t..."
links.english: "Because people either show up on their own or you'll never find them," he says with a flash of teeth.
links.polish: „Bo ludzie wracają do domu sami albo nie wracają wcale – i nigdy się ich nie odnajduje” – dodaje, błyskając zębami.
links.belarusian: "Бо людзі вяртаюцца дадому самі альбо не вяртаюцца наогул — і іх ніколі не знаходзяць", — дадае, ззяючы зубамі.

links.title: You: ""You're right, unfortunately our fo..."
links.english: "You're right, unfortunately our forces are limited. I'm sure he'll return on his own." (Don't take the case.)
links.polish: „Racja, niestety, nasze zasoby ludzkie są ograniczone. Na pewno wróci w końcu sam”. (Nie przyjmuj sprawy).
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды, на жаль, нашы чалавечыя рэсурсы абмежаваныя. Напэўна, нарэшце вернецца сам". (Не прымаць справу).

links.title: You: ""Don't worry, I'm going to find him..."
links.english: "Don't worry, I'm going to find him and bring him back home, promise."
links.polish: „Bez obaw, znajdę go i sprowadzę do domu. Obiecuję”.
links.belarusian: "Не хвалюйся, я знайду яго і паспрабую прывесці дадому. Абяцаю".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She sighs, but you can detect a sli..."
links.english: She sighs, but you can detect a slight hint of gratitude and relief from her face.
links.polish: Wzdycha, ale na jej twarzy pojawia się cień wdzięczności i ulgi.
links.belarusian: Уздыхае, але на яе твары з'яўляецца цень удзячнасці і палёгкі.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Alright, go ahead. Do you have any..."
links.english: "Alright, go ahead. Do you have any questions?"
links.polish: „W porządku, powodzenia. Ma pan do mnie jeszcze jakieś pytania?”
links.belarusian: "У парадку, поспехаў. У вас ёсць да мяне яшчэ нейкія пытанні?"

links.title: You: ""Well, if he's with his *friends*,..."
links.english: "Well, if he's with his *friends*, then he's not really missing. No need for the police to get involved." (Don't take the case.)
links.polish: „No dobrze, skoro jest z *kumplami*, to tak naprawdę nie zaginął. Nie ma co mieszać w to policji”. (Nie przyjmuj sprawy).
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, калі ён з *брандзамі*, то на самай справе не знік. Няма сэнсу залучаць у гэта паліцыю". (Не прымаць справу).

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She just nods, still staring into t..."
links.english: She just nods, still staring into the distance. Some seagulls fly over her head.
links.polish: Przytakuje, wciąż wpatrując się w dal. Nad jej głową przelatują mewy.
links.belarusian: Ківае, усё яшчэ ўглядаючыся ў далячыню. Над яе галавой пралятаюць чайкі.

links.title: You: ""I'm not saying 'what'.""
links.english: "I'm not saying 'what'."
links.polish: „Nie powiem »co«”.
links.belarusian: "Не скажу "што"".

links.title: You: ""Something bad I guess? I'm sorry,..."
links.english: "Something bad I guess? I'm sorry, I say stupid things sometimes, I didn't mean to annoy."
links.polish: „Pewnie coś złego? Przepraszam, czasem mówię głupie rzeczy, nie chciałem urazić”.
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, нешта дрэннае? Прабачце, часам кажу глупствы, не хацеў пакрыўдзіць".

links.title: You: ""Right around the corner. He has pi..."
links.english: "Right around the corner. He has pissed himself."
links.polish: „Tuż za rogiem. Urżnął się w trupa”.
links.belarusian: "Зусім побач. Напіўся ў нішто".

links.title: You: ""Our hammer toting comrade was at t..."
links.english: "Our hammer toting comrade was at the bottom of those stairs."
links.polish: „Nasz władający młotkiem towarzysz przebywa u stóp tamtych schodów”.
links.belarusian: "Наш таварыш, які валодае малатком, знаходзіцца ў падножжа тых сходаў".

links.title: You: ""Well, I found him nevertheless. I'..."
links.english: "Well, I found him nevertheless. I'm that good."
links.polish: „No, tak czy inaczej go znalazłem. Taki jestem w tym dobry”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, так ці інакш я яго знайшоў. Вось такі я добры ў гэтым".

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about your husband agai..."
links.english: "Let's talk about your husband again."
links.polish: „Porozmawiajmy jeszcze o pani mężu”.
links.belarusian: "Пагаворым яшчэ пра вашага мужа".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Right. What about him?" Her face b..."
links.english: "Right. What about him?" Her face becomes anxious again.
links.polish: „Tak. Co z nim?” – na jej twarzy znowu pojawia się niepokój.
links.belarusian: "Так. І што з ім?" – на яе твары зноў з'яўляецца трывога.

links.title: You: ""What does your husband look like?""
links.english: "What does your husband look like?"
links.polish: „Jak wygląda pani mąż?”
links.belarusian: "Як выглядае ваш муж?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Honestly, not that different from..."
links.english: "Honestly, not that different from you." She eyes you from head to toe.
links.polish: „Szczerze mówiąc, niewiele się od pana różni” – odpowiada, przyglądając ci się od góry do dołu.
links.belarusian: "Шчыра кажучы, мала чым ад вас адрозніваецца," – адказвае, разглядаючы вас з галавы да пят.

links.title: You: ""So let me guess... he's *disco*?""
links.english: "So let me guess... he's *disco*?"
links.polish: „Zatem niech zgadnę... jest *disco*?”
links.belarusian: "Тады дазволь мне здагадацца... ёсць *дыска*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh, thank god, no!" She nearly beg..."
links.english: "Oh, thank god, no!" She nearly begins to laugh. "It hasn't come down to *this* yet."
links.polish: „Och, dzięki bogu nie!” – odpowiada, wybuchając niemal śmiechem. „Do *tego* jeszcze nie doszło”.
links.belarusian: "О, дзякуй Богу, не!" — адказвае, амаль выбухнуўшы смехам. "Да *гэтага* яшчэ не дайшло".

links.title: Half Light: "Hold on! Did she just laugh at your..."
links.english: Hold on! Did she just laugh at your disco pants? You're not going to leave it there, are you?
links.polish: Zaraz! Czy ona właśnie wyśmiała twoje disco portki? Chyba tego tak nie zostawisz, co?
links.belarusian: Пачакай! Яна толькі што пасьмяялася з тваіх дыскатэчных штаноў? Напэўна, ты гэтак ня пакінеш, што?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Technically speaking, your trousers..."
links.english: Technically speaking, your trousers could be considered part of your work gear. This means she has insulted *the police*.
links.polish: Będąc drobiazgowym, można uznać, że twoje spodnie to część twojego munduru. A to znaczy, że właśnie obraziła *policję*.
links.belarusian: Будучы дэталёвым, можна лічыць, што твае штаны частка твайго мундзіру. А гэта значыць, што ты толькі што абразіла *міліцыю*.

links.title: Half Light: "Hold on! Did she just laugh at disc..."
links.english: Hold on! Did she just laugh at disco? You're not going to leave it there, are you?
links.polish: Zaraz! Czy ona właśnie wyśmiała disco? Chyba tego tak nie zostawisz, co?
links.belarusian: Пачакай! Яна толькі што насмяялася з дыска? Напэўна, ты гэта так не пакінеш, так?

links.title: You: ""Wow, ma'am! Do we have a *problem*..."
links.english: "Wow, ma'am! Do we have a *problem* here?"
links.polish: „No, proszę pani! Czy my mamy tu jakiś *problem*?”
links.belarusian: "Не, спадарыня! Ці мы маем тут нейкую *праблему*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What problem?""
links.english: "What problem?"
links.polish: „Jaki problem?”
links.belarusian: "Якая праблема?"

links.title: You: ""Do we have a problem with *police*?""
links.english: "Do we have a problem with *police*?"
links.polish: „Mamy jakiś problem z *policją*?”
links.belarusian: "У нас якіясьці праблемы з *паліцыяй*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Police? I don't follow." She narro..."
links.english: "Police? I don't follow." She narrows her eyes, trying to understand.
links.polish: „Z policją? Nie rozumiem” – mruży oczy, próbując odnaleźć w tym jakiś sens.
links.belarusian: "З міліцыяй? Не разумею", — прыжмурыўшыся, ён спрабуе знайсці ў гэтым хоць нейкі сэнс.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What does anything I said have to..."
links.english: "What does anything I said have to do with police? Or is *Police* some kind of disco phenomenon as well?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego wszystko, co powiem, musi mieć jakiś związek z policją? A może »policja« to też jakiś fenomen disco?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму ўсё, што я кажу, павінна мець нейкае дачыненне да міліцыі? А можа, "міліцыя" - гэта таксама нейкі феномен дыска?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, I make disco become a police..."
links.english: "Yes, I make disco become a police thing -- and you have just insulted my style."
links.polish: „Tak, disco jest dla mnie sprawą policyjną. A pani właśnie obraziła mój styl”.
links.belarusian: "Так, дыска для мяне — гэта справа паліцыі. А вы толькі што абразілі мой стыль".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh, no! That's not what I meant!"..."
links.english: "Oh, no! That's not what I meant!" She takes a step back.
links.polish: „O nie! Nie to miałam na myśli!” – zapewnia i robi krok w tył.
links.belarusian: "О не! Не гэта я мела на ўвазе!" – запэўнівае і робіць крок назад.

links.title: You: ""No. But I am an officer of the law..."
links.english: "No. But I am an officer of the law and you have just insulted my work uniform."
links.polish: „Nie. Ale jestem funkcjonariuszem porządku, a pani właśnie obraziła mój mundur”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Але я з'яўляюся супрацоўнікам правапарадку, а вы толькі што абразілі маю форму".

links.title: You: ""Do we have a problem with *disco*?""
links.english: "Do we have a problem with *disco*?"
links.polish: „Mamy jakiś problem z *disco*?”
links.belarusian: "У нас нейкая праблема з *disco*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, no..." she backs off, "my rela..."
links.english: "No, no..." she backs off, "my relationship with disco remains irrefutably healthy."
links.polish: „Nie, nie...” – wycofuje się. „Moje relacje z disco pozostają nieodmiennie zdrowe”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не..." — адступаецца. "Мае адносіны з диско застаюцца нязменна здаровымі".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What I was trying to say before is..."
links.english: "What I was trying to say before is that he's a little bit chubby, that's all. I didn't mean anything offensive!"
links.polish: „Chodziło mi tylko o to, że mąż jest pulchny, to wszystko. Nie miałam na myśli niczego obraźliwego!”
links.belarusian: "Я толькі мела на ўвазе, што муж поўны, вось і ўсё. Я не мела на ўвазе нічога абразлівага!"

links.title: You: ""Why did you say that your husband..."
links.english: "Why did you say that your husband resembles me then?"
links.polish: „To czemu powiedziała pani, że mąż jest podobny do mnie?”
links.belarusian: "Дык чаму вы сказалі, што ваш муж падобны да мяне?"

links.title: You: ""Like a late-stage alcoholic then.""
links.english: "Like a late-stage alcoholic then."
links.polish: „Czyli jak alkoholik w późnym stadium choroby”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта як алкаголік на позняй стадыі хваробы".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""That's one way to put it, yes. No..."
links.english: "That's one way to put it, yes. No offence. I'd also add that he's a little bit chubby."
links.polish: „Tak też to można ująć, tak. Bez obrazy. Chciałabym też dodać, że jest pulchny”.
links.belarusian: "Таксама можна так сказаць, так. Без крыўды. Я таксама хацела б дадаць, што ён пульхны".

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Wait! Did she just imply that you'r..."
links.english: Wait! Did she just imply that you're *fat*? You're not fat! The body type she's referring to is called a *Franconigerian hard-body*.
links.polish: Chwileczkę! Czy ona właśnie stwierdziła, że jesteś *gruby*? Nie jesteś gruby! Sylwetka, o której ona mówi, nazywa się *frankonigeryjskim ciałem*!
links.belarusian: Пачакай хвілінку! Ці яна толькі што сказала, што ты *грубы*? Ты не грубы! Сілуэт, пра які яна кажа, называецца *франконігерычаскае цела*!

links.title: You: ""I'm not *chubby* and neither is yo..."
links.english: "I'm not *chubby* and neither is your husband. What you meant to say is that we both share a *Franconigerian hard-body*."
links.polish: „Nie jestem *pulchny* i pani mąż też nie. Chciała pani powiedzieć, że mamy obaj wspaniałe *frankonigeryjskie ciała*”.
links.belarusian: "Я не *пухлы*, і ваш муж таксама не. Вы хацелі сказаць, што ў нас абодвух цудоўныя *франконігерарскія целы*".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""You both share *what*?" She doesn'..."
links.english: "You both share *what*?" She doesn't understand.
links.polish: „*Co* obaj macie?” – kobieta nic z tego nie rozumie.
links.belarusian: "*Што* абодва маеце?" — жанчына нічога з гэтага не разумее.

links.title: You: ""*Franconigerian hard-body*. Softly..."
links.english: "*Franconigerian hard-body*. Softly round, yet still in shape. Ladies dig it."
links.polish: „*Frankonigeryjskie ciało*. Miękkie i krągłe, a mimo to w formie. Panie takie lubią”.
links.belarusian: "*Франканігерайскае цела*. Мяккае і круглае, а тым не менш у форме. Жанчыны такое любяць".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I'm not sure about the rest, but s..."
links.english: "I'm not sure about the rest, but softly round sounds about right. He's not in great shape." She stops to think.
links.polish: „Nie jestem pewna, co do reszty, ale miękkie i krągłe to by się zgadzało. Nie jest w najlepszej formie” – zamyśla się.
links.belarusian: "Не ўпэўненая наконт астатняга, але мяккае і круглае — гэта дакладна падыходзіць. Не ў лепшай форме", — задумалася яна.

links.title: You: ""I see. What else?""
links.english: "I see. What else?"
links.polish: „Rozumiem. Coś poza tym?”
links.belarusian: "Разумею. Што-небудзь акрамя гэтага?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What else... He was wearing a dark..."
links.english: "What else... He was wearing a dark brown leather jacket with a bright blue inner lining. The lining is hand-sewn, I made it myself." She sighs, her voice slightly quivering when she adds:
links.polish: „Co jeszcze... Miał na sobie ciemnobrązową skórzaną kurtkę z jasnoniebieską podpinką. Podpinka jest ręcznie wszyta, sama ją zrobiłam” – wzdycha, po czym dodaje lekko drżącym głosem:
links.belarusian: "Што яшчэ... На ім была цёмна-карычневая скураная куртка са светла-блакітнай падкладкай. Падкладка была пашыта ўручную, я сама яе зрабіла", — уздыхае яна і дадае крыху дрыжачым голасам:

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's his *cool jacket*. God knows..."
links.english: "It's his *cool jacket*. God knows it's too cold to run around in this, but he refuses to change."
links.polish: „To jego *fajowa kurtka*. Za zimno, żeby w czymś takim chodzić, ale się upiera”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта яго *класная куртка*. Занадта халодна, каб у ёй хадзіць, але ён настойвае".

links.title: Composure: "Who cares about the cold when you h..."
links.english: Who cares about the cold when you have your *cool jacket* to wear? You can completely sympathize.
links.polish: Kogo obchodzi zimno, jeśli możesz chodzić w swojej *fajowej kurtce*? Doskonale to rozumiesz.
links.belarusian: Каго хвалюе холад, калі можаш хадзіць у сваёй *крутой куртцы*? Выдатна гэта разумееш.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I even tried throwing it away once..."
links.english: "I even tried throwing it away once, but he just dug it out of the bin. Can you believe it?" She looks back at you, shaking her head.
links.polish: „Raz próbowałam nawet mu ją wyrzucić, ale wygrzebał ją ze śmietnika. Uwierzyłby pan?” – spogląda na ciebie i kręci głową.
links.belarusian: "Раз я нават спрабавала яе выкінуць яму, але ён выцягнуў яе з смеццевай скрыні. Верылі б вы?" — глядзіць на цябе і круціць галавой.

links.title: You: ""Well, if that jacket is really *th..."
links.english: "Well, if that jacket is really *that cool*, then I can totally understand..."
links.polish: „No, jeśli ta kurtka jest rzeczywiście aż tak *fajowa*, to całkowicie go rozumiem...”
links.belarusian: "Ну, калі гэтая куртка сапраўды настолькі *класная*, то цалкам яго разумею..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Well, what can you do... I hope th..."
links.english: "Well, what can you do... I hope that at least that extra lining helps him keep warm at night. I wouldn't like him to catch cold."
links.polish: „No i co człowiek ma począć... Mam nadzieję, że przynajmniej ta dodatkowa podpinka chroni go nocą przed zimnem. Nie chciałabym, żeby się przeziębił”.
links.belarusian: "Ну і што чалавек павінен рабіць... Спадзяюся, што хаця б гэтая дадатковая падкладка абараняе яго ўначы ад холаду. Я не хацела б, каб ён прастудзіўся".

links.title: Empathy: "She's thinking about him out in the..."
links.english: She's thinking about him out in the cold -- in some park or on the coast -- and it's making her more and more worried.
links.polish: Myśli o nim, jak gdzieś tam marznie – w parku albo na wybrzeżu – i zaczyna martwić się coraz bardziej.
links.belarusian: Думае пра яго, як ён недзе там мёрзне – у парку ці на ўзбярэжжы – і пачынае ўсё больш турбавацца.

links.title: You: ""He *took it out of the bin*? Wow...."
links.english: "He *took it out of the bin*? Wow. That's filthy."
links.polish: „*Wyciągnął ją ze śmietnika*? O rany. Ale brudas”.
links.belarusian: "*Выцягнуў яе са сметніцы*? Ой, Божа. Але брудзіла".

links.title: You: ""Right -- we're dealing with a cop.""
links.english: "Right -- we're dealing with a cop."
links.polish: „Dobrze. Czyli mamy do czynienia z policjantem”.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Значыць, мы маем справу з паліцэйскім".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, no!" Her eyes widen at your mi..."
links.english: "No, no!" Her eyes widen at your misunderstanding. "He is definitely not a cop. I meant that he's a little chubby, that's all."
links.polish: „Nie, nie!” – zaprzecza, a jej oczy rozszerzają się na myśl o tym nieporozumieniu. „Zdecydowanie nie jest policjantem. Miałam na myśli, że jest pulchny, to wszystko”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не!" – пярэчыць яна, і яе вочы павялічваюцца ад думкі пра гэтае непаразуменне. "Відавочна, ён не міліцыянер. Я мела на ўвазе, што ён пухлы, вось і ўсё".

links.title: You: ""What do you mean by that?""
links.english: "What do you mean by that?"
links.polish: „Co ma pani na myśli?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы маеце на ўвазе?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Well, he's... slightly chubby.""
links.english: "Well, he's... slightly chubby."
links.polish: „Cóż, on jest... pulchny”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, ён... пульхны".

links.title: You: ""When did you last see him?""
links.english: "When did you last see him?"
links.polish: „Kiedy widziała go pani po raz ostatni?”
links.belarusian: "Калі вы бачылі яго ў апошні раз?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yesterday morning. He went to the..."
links.english: "Yesterday morning. He went to the library." Her eyes become cold with recollection. "He went to retrieve my book and he promised, he *promised* he'd walk straight back home."
links.polish: „Wczoraj rano. Poszedł do biblioteki” – w jej oczach pojawia się zimny błysk, gdy sobie o tym przypomina. „Miał odebrać moją książkę i obiecał – *obiecał* mi – że wróci prosto do domu”.
links.belarusian: "Учора раніцай. Ён пайшоў у бібліятэку", — у яе вачах з'яўляецца халодны бліск, калі яна пра гэта ўзгадвае. "Ён павінен быў забраць маю кнігу і паабяцаў — *паабяцаў* мне — што вернецца адразу дадому".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Because we talked about this. We t..."
links.english: "Because we talked about this. We talked about not wandering off again!" She scoffs. "I don't know what to do! I honestly don't know what to do with his addiction... It just makes me feel weak."
links.polish: „Bo rozmawialiśmy już o tym. O nie znikaniu bez słowa!” – prycha. „Nie wiem, co robić! Naprawdę nie wiem, co robić z tym jego nałogiem... Ręce mi od tego opadają”.
links.belarusian: "Бо мы ўжо пра гэта гаварылі. Пра тое, што нельга знікнуць без слова!" — фыркае. "Не ведаю, што рабіць! Сапраўды не ведаю, што рабіць з гэтай яго залежнасцю... Рукі апускаюцца".

links.title: Logic: "Gone for around 36 hours then? Damn..."
links.english: Gone for around 36 hours then? Damn, this *is* a missing persons case.
links.polish: Czyli nie pojawił się od jakichś 36 godzin? Rany, to naprawdę *jest* zaginięcie.
links.belarusian: То бок ён не з'яўляўся каля 36 гадзін? Божа, гэта сапраўды *ёсць* знікненне.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She turns away from you in an attem..."
links.english: She turns away from you in an attempt to recover.
links.polish: Odwraca się, aby dojść jakoś do siebie.
links.belarusian: Паварочваецца, каб неяк апамятацца.

links.title: You: ""I think I got it, thanks." (Procee..."
links.english: "I think I got it, thanks." (Proceed.)
links.polish: „Chyba już wszystko wiem, dziękuję”. (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "Здаецца, я ўжо ўсё ведаю, дзякуй". (Перайсці далей).

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She gives you a short nod, before r..."
links.english: She gives you a short nod, before returning to her books.
links.polish: Kiwa głową, po czym wraca do czytania swojej książki.
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой, пасля чаго вяртаецца да чытання сваёй кнігі.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""So you *are* going to look for him?""
links.english: "So you *are* going to look for him?"
links.polish: „Więc *poszuka* go pan?”
links.belarusian: "Дык *пашукаеце* яго?"

links.title: Suggestion: "She genuinely wants you to, now. Do..."
links.english: She genuinely wants you to, now. Don't make her ask.
links.polish: Ona naprawdę tego chce. Nie każ jej prosić.
links.belarusian: Яна сапраўды гэтага хоча. Не прымушайце яе прасіць.

links.title: You: ""Yes, I will bring him back home to..."
links.english: "Yes, I will bring him back home to you." (Take the case.)
links.polish: „Tak, sprowadzę go pani do domu”. (Przyjmij sprawę).
links.belarusian: "Так, прывяду яго да вас дадому". (Прыміце справу).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Thank you!" You sense gratitude in..."
links.english: "Thank you!" You sense gratitude in her voice. "Please, do... Even though I'm sure he will return home by himself. I'm still sure of that."
links.polish: „Dziękuję!” W jej głosie słychać wdzięczność. „Proszę go poszukać... Choć jestem przekonana, że wróci do domu sam z siebie. Wciąż jestem tego pewna”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй!" У яе голасе чуваць удзячнасць. "Калі ласка, пашукайце яго... Хоць я ўпэўненая, што ён вернецца дадому сам. Я ўсё яшчэ ўпэўненая ў гэтым".

links.title: Volition: "She tries to maintain a brave front..."
links.english: She tries to maintain a brave front, even though her eyes reveal the opposite.
links.polish: Próbuje trzymać się dzielnie, lecz jej oczy zdradzają, że to tylko poza.
links.belarusian: Яна стараецца трымацца мужна, але яе вочы выдаюць, што гэта толькі маска.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sure he will too. When he does..."
links.english: "I'm sure he will too. When he does, would you let Precinct 57 -- Kim Kitsuragi -- know." He gives her a slip of paper.
links.polish: „Też jestem tego pewny. Gdy się pojawi, proszę mnie o tym poinformować. Kim Kitsuragi z 57. komisariatu” – wręcza jej kawałek papieru.
links.belarusian: "Я таксама ўпэўнены ў гэтым. Калі ён з'явіцца, калі ласка, праінфармуйце мяне аб гэтым. Кім Кіцурагі з 57-га камісарыята", – перадае ёй кавалак паперы.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I will. Of course, officer. As I s..."
links.english: "I will. Of course, officer. As I said, it's probably nothing." The woman takes the slip of paper. It's a phone number.
links.polish: „Tak zrobię. Oczywiście, panie policjancie. Jak już mówiłam, to pewnie nic takiego” – kobieta przyjmuje kawałek papieru. Jest na nim numer telefonu.
links.belarusian: "Так зраблю. Вядома, спадар поліцэйскі. Як я ўжо казала, гэта, напэўна, нічога важнага", — жанчына прымае кавалак паперы. На ім нумар тэлефона.

links.title: You: ""Sorry, we've got our hands full at..."
links.english: "Sorry, we've got our hands full at the moment. Maybe some time later." (Don't take the case.)
links.polish: „Niestety, jesteśmy obecnie bardzo zajęci. Może jakoś później”. (Nie przyjmuj sprawy).
links.belarusian: "На жаль, мы зараз вельмі занятыя. Можа быць пазней". (Не прымайце справы).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes. Right." A wave of despair swe..."
links.english: "Yes. Right." A wave of despair sweeps over her face. "He wasn't missing anyway," she tries to say while struggling to maintain a courageous front, "I'm sure he'll be home."
links.polish: „Tak. Racja” – na jej twarzy pojawia się cień desperacji. „Przecież nie zaginął” – próbuje przekonać samą siebie, walcząc jednocześnie, by zachować pozory odwagi. „Jestem pewna, że wróci do domu”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Праўда" — на яе твары з'яўляецца адбітак роспачы. "Ж жа ён не знік" — спрабуе пераканаць сябе, змагаючыся адначасова, каб захаваць прыстойнасць адвагі. "Я ўпэўнена, што ён вернецца дадому".

links.title: Empathy: "It is clear from her voice that she..."
links.english: It is clear from her voice that she is shattered.
links.polish: Słychać wyraźnie w jej głosie, że jest zdruzgotana.
links.belarusian: Чуваць ясна ў яе голасе, што яна спустошаная.

links.title: You: ""You were right that I'm a cockatoo.""
links.english: "You were right that I'm a cockatoo."
links.polish: „Miała pani rację, rzeczywiście jestem kakadu”.
links.belarusian: "Вы мелі рацыю, насамрэч я какаду".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Excuse me?""
links.english: "Excuse me?"
links.polish: „Słucham?”
links.belarusian: "Слухаю?"

links.title: You: ""I went and read up on them, just l..."
links.english: "I went and read up on them, just like you said. And I even decided on what kind of a cockatoo I am. Want to know?"
links.polish: „Poczytałem o nich trochę, jak pani mówiła. I nawet zdecydowałem, którą jestem. Chce pani wiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Пачытаў пра іх крыху, як вы казалі. І нават вырашыў, якім з'яўляюся. Хочаце ведаць?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I don't know, the most talkative o..."
links.english: "I don't know, the most talkative one?" She's ready to put that question aside.
links.polish: „Czy ja wiem? Najbardziej gadatliwą?” Jest gotowa, by mieć to pytanie za sobą.
links.belarusian: "Ці я ведаю? Найбольш балбатлівая?" Яна гатовае, каб мець гэтае пытанне за сабой.

links.title: You: ""No, I'm the bang-bang cockatoo.""
links.english: "No, I'm the bang-bang cockatoo."
links.polish: „Nie, jestem kakadu krasnogłową”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я чырванагаловая какаду".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""The what now?!""
links.english: "The what now?!"
links.polish: „Że co?!”
links.belarusian: "Што?!"

links.title: You: ""The bang-bang cockatoo. It's the m..."
links.english: "The bang-bang cockatoo. It's the most common one."
links.polish: „Kakadu krasnogłową. To ta najpospolitsza”.
links.belarusian: "Какаду чырвонагаловая. Гэта самая распаўсюджаная".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The woman looks baffled by your per..."
links.english: The woman looks baffled by your personal revelation. "You truly are one *strange* cop, aren't you?" she says, slowly shaking her head.
links.polish: Kobieta wygląda na zaskoczoną twoimi osobistymi wynurzeniami. „Rzeczywiście jest pan *dziwnym* policjantem, prawda?” – stwierdza, powoli kręcąc głową.
links.belarusian: Жанчына выглядае здзіўленай вашымі асабістымі прызнаннямі. "Сапраўды, вы *дзіўны* паліцэйскі, праўда?" — кажа яна, павольна ківаючы галавой.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The wind brings a strand of hair to..."
links.english: The wind brings a strand of hair to her rough face. "I have a strange cop offering to find my stupid husband. What a day..."
links.polish: Wiatr przesuwa kosmyk włosów na jej ogorzałą twarz. „Dziwny policjant proponuje, że znajdzie mojego głupiego męża. Ależ dzień...”
links.belarusian: Вецер перасоўвае пасму валасоў на яе загарэлым твары. "Дзіўны паліцэйскі прапануе знайсці майго дурнога мужа. Што за дзень..."

links.title: You: ""The funeral cockatoo. It's the mos..."
links.english: "The funeral cockatoo. It's the most depressing one."
links.polish: „Żałobnicą żółtosterną. Najbardziej ponurą kakaduowatą”.
links.belarusian: "Жалобніцай жаўтахвостай. Найбольш панурай какаду".

links.title: You: ""The Major Majestic cockatoo. It's..."
links.english: "The Major Majestic cockatoo. It's the most impressive one."
links.polish: „Kakadu ognistoczubą. Tą najpiękniejszą”.
links.belarusian: "Какаду з вогненным хохлікам. Тую найпрыгажэйшую".

links.title: You: ""The fuckupatoo. It's the one who a..."
links.english: "The fuckupatoo. It's the one who always fucks everything up."
links.polish: „Zjebadu. To ta, która zawsze musi wszystko zjebać”.
links.belarusian: "Зьебаду. Гэта тая, якая заўсёды павінна ўсё спаганіць".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, you're not. Don't think that....."
links.english: "No, you're not. Don't think that..." she says, slowly shaking her head. The wind brings a strand of hair to her rough face. "You're the cockatoo who offered to find my stupid husband. Let's leave it at that."
links.polish: „Nie, nie jest pan nią. Proszę tak nie myśleć...” – odpowiada, powoli kręcąc głową. Wiatr przesuwa kosmyk włosów na jej ogorzałą twarz. „Jest pan kakadu, która zaoferowała, że znajdzie mojego głupiego męża. Zostańmy przy tym”.
links.belarusian: "Не, вы не яна. Калі ласка, не думайце так..." — адказвае яна, павольна круцячы галавой. Вецер рухае пасму валасоў на яе загарэлы твар. "Вы какатуа, якая прапанавала знайсці майго дурнога мужа. Застаёмся на гэтым".

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't want you to be the fuck..."
links.english: She doesn't want you to be the fuckupatoo.
links.polish: Nie chce, żebyś był zjebadu.
links.belarusian: Я не хачу, каб ты быў зломленным.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, you're not. Don't think that w..."
links.english: "No, you're not. Don't think that way..." she says, slowly shaking her head. The wind brings a strand of hair to her rough face. "You're just a regular talkative cockatoo and let's leave it at that, okay?"
links.polish: „Nie, nie jest pan nią. Proszę tak nie myśleć...” – odpowiada, powoli kręcąc głową. Wiatr przesuwa kosmyk włosów na jej ogorzałą twarz. „Jest pan zwykłą, gadatliwą kakadu i przy tym zostańmy, dobrze?”
links.belarusian: "Не, вы не яна. Прошу так не думаць…" — адказвае яна, павольна хістаючы галавой. Вецер адводзіць пасму валасоў на яе абветранае твар. "Вы звычайная, гаварлівая какаду, і на гэтым спынімся, добра?"

links.title: You: ""No, I'm the funeral cockatoo.""
links.english: "No, I'm the funeral cockatoo."
links.polish: „Nie, jestem żałobnicą żółtosterną”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я кустадзёрка жаўтахвостая".

links.title: You: ""No, I'm the Major Majestic cockato..."
links.english: "No, I'm the Major Majestic cockatoo."
links.polish: „Nie, jestem kakadu ognistoczubą”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я — какаду з агнявым хахлом".

links.title: You: ""No, I'm the fuckupatoo.""
links.english: "No, I'm the fuckupatoo."
links.polish: „Nie, jestem zjebadu”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я з'ебаду".

links.title: You: ""Forget it. It's too personal.""
links.english: "Forget it. It's too personal."
links.polish: „Nieważne. To zbyt osobiste”.
links.belarusian: "Не важна. Гэта занадта асабіста".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Some things *are* officer." She no..."
links.english: "Some things *are* officer." She nods. Her cheeks are red from the cold.
links.polish: „Niektóre rzeczy takie właśnie *są*, funkcjonariuszu” – kiwa głową. Jej policzki są czerwone od zimna.
links.belarusian: "Некаторыя рэчы менавіта так *ёсць*, афіцэр", — ківае яна галавой. Яе шчокі чырвоныя ад марозу.

links.title: You: ""Maybe your husband is missing?""
links.english: "Maybe your husband is missing?"
links.polish: „Może zaginął pani mąż?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, знік ваш муж?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""My husband? No, he's not.""
links.english: "My husband? No, he's not."
links.polish: „Mój mąż? Nie, nie zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "Мой муж? Не, не знік".

links.title: You: ""This little girl over there told m..."
links.english: "This little girl over there told me you have a bad husband."
links.polish: „Tamta dziewczynka powiedziała mi, że ma pani niedobrego męża”.
links.belarusian: "Та дзяўчынка сказала мне, што ў вас дрэнны муж".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Excuse me, a *bad husband?*" Her b..."
links.english: "Excuse me, a *bad husband?*" Her back straightens. "What do you mean?"
links.polish: „Co, proszę? *Niedobrego męża*?” – prostuje się. „Co to ma znaczyć?”
links.belarusian: "Што, прабачце? *Дрэннага мужа*?" – выпрастаецца. "Што гэта значыць?"

links.title: You: ""Not a nice and helpful sort.""
links.english: "Not a nice and helpful sort."
links.polish: „To, że nie jest miły i pomocny”.
links.belarusian: "Тое, што ён не з'яўляецца ветлівым і дапаможным".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Do *police men* just go around rep..."
links.english: "Do *police men* just go around repeating what some kid off the street said?"
links.polish: „Czy *policjanci* zajmują się powtarzaniem tego, co mówią jakieś dzieciaki na ulicy?”
links.belarusian: "Ці займаюцца *міліцыянеры* паўторам таго, што кажуць нейкія дзеці на вуліцы?"

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't mean to be antagonistic..."
links.english: She doesn't mean to be antagonistic, but she can't help coming off defensive.
links.polish: Nie chce być wobec ciebie wroga, ale mimo to wydaje się dość nieprzyjemna.
links.belarusian: Я не хачу быць да цябе варожым, але ўсё роўна яна здаецца даволі непрыемнай.

links.title: You: ""Those were her words, not mine. I'..."
links.english: "Those were her words, not mine. I'm merely asking."
links.polish: „To nie moje słowa, a jej. Ja tylko pytam”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта не мае словы, а яе. Я толькі пытаюся".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Can I give you some friendly advic..."
links.english: "Can I give you some friendly advice, mister policeman? Don't listen to kids."
links.polish: „Czy mogę dać panu, panie policjancie, przyjacielską radę? Proszę nie słuchać dzieci”.
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я даць вам, спадар афіцэр, сяброўскую параду? Калі ласка, не слухайце дзяцей".

links.title: You: ""So you don't have a bad husband?""
links.english: "So you don't have a bad husband?"
links.polish: „A więc nie ma pani niedobrego męża?”
links.belarusian: "Дык у вас няма дрэннага мужа?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I don't. I have a good husband..."
links.english: "No, I don't. I have a good husband, the kind and helpful sort. And he's *not* missing."
links.polish: „Nie, nie mam. Mój mąż jest dobry i pomocny. I *nie* zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не маю. Мой муж добры і дапаможны. І *не* знік".

links.title: Empathy: "He's totally missing."
links.english: He's totally missing.
links.polish: Zaginął jak nic.
links.belarusian: Знік як нішто.

links.title: You: ""She isn't just some 'kid off the s..."
links.english: "She isn't just some 'kid off the street'. She seems very mature for her age."
links.polish: „To nie jest byle dzieciak z ulicy. Jest bardzo dojrzała jak na swój wiek”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта не нейкі вулічны дзіця. Яна вельмі дарослая для свайго ўзросту".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Is she now?" She dries her hands i..."
links.english: "Is she now?" She dries her hands in the apron underneath her coat. Her eyes narrow.
links.polish: „Doprawdy?” – pyta, wycierając dłonie w fartuch pod swoim płaszczem. Mruży oczy.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды?" – пытаецца, выціраючы рукі ў фартух пад сваім паліто. Мружыць вочы.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Annette's a sweet sprout, but she..."
links.english: "Annette's a sweet sprout, but she doesn't know anything about marriage. Why am I even talking about this..."
links.polish: „Annette to słodki szczypiorek, ale nie ma zielonego pojęcia o małżeństwie. Dlaczego my o tym w ogóle rozmawiamy...?”
links.belarusian: "Анет — гэта салодкі шніт-ц cibuli, але яна не мае зялёнага паняцця пра шлюб. Чаму мы наогул пра гэта гаворым...?"

links.title: You: ""So where could he be?""
links.english: "So where could he be?"
links.polish: „Gdzie zatem może być?”
links.belarusian: "Дзе ж тады ён можа быць?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I don't know, at home now? Out dri..."
links.english: "I don't know, at home now? Out drinking with his friends? Working?"
links.polish: „Nie wiem, w domu? Może pije gdzieś z kumplami? Albo jest w pracy?”
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, дома? Можа, дзесьці п'е з сябрамі? Ці на працы?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Where is this going, officer?""
links.english: "Where is this going, officer?"
links.polish: „Do czego to zmierza, oficerze?”
links.belarusian: "Да чаго гэта вядзе, афіцэр?"

links.title: You: ""So what I'm hearing is: you don't..."
links.english: "So what I'm hearing is: you don't really *know* where your husband is."
links.polish: „Czyli mówi mi pani, że *nie wie* pani tak właściwie, gdzie jest pani mąż”.
links.belarusian: "То бок, вы мне кажаце, што на самай справе *не ведаеце*, дзе ваш муж".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes, but..." She looks around and..."
links.english: "Yes, but..." She looks around and takes a deep breath, a little annoyed. "I don't really need to know where my husband is. Not all the time."
links.polish: „Tak, ale...” – lekko zirytowana rozgląda się wokół i bierze głęboki wdech. „Naprawdę nie muszę wiedzieć, gdzie jest mój mąż. Nie przez cały czas”.
links.belarusian: "Так, але..." – злёгку раздражнёная аглядаецца вакол і робіць глыбокі ўдых. "Сапраўды не мушу ведаць, дзе мой муж. Не ўвесь час".

links.title: You: ""Wouldn't you like to?""
links.english: "Wouldn't you like to?"
links.polish: „A nie chciałaby pani?”
links.belarusian: "А не хацелі б вы?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No." She looks you straight into t..."
links.english: "No." She looks you straight into the eye. Her right foot is tapping nervously.
links.polish: „Nie” – odpowiada, patrząc ci prosto w oczy. Potupuje nerwowo prawą stopą.
links.belarusian: "Не" — адказвае ён, гледзячы табе проста ў вочы. Нервова тупае правай нагой.

links.title: You: ""I can totally help you find your m..."
links.english: "I can totally help you find your missing husband."
links.polish: „Absolutnie mogę pani pomóc w znalezieniu zaginionego męża”.
links.belarusian: "Абсалютна магу вам дапамагчы ў пошуку зніклага мужа".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Why are we still talking about thi..."
links.english: "Why are we still talking about this? I haven't lost my husband."
links.polish: „Dlaczego pan ciągle o tym mówi? Mój mąż nie zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "Чаму вы ўвесь час пра гэта гаворыце? Мой муж не прапаў".

links.title: Empathy: "She has though. The husband is tota..."
links.english: She has though. The husband is totally lost. You should tell her that it's okay.
links.polish: A jednak zgubiła. Jej mąż zaginął jak nic. Lepiej jej powiedz, żeby się nie przejmowała.
links.belarusian: А ўсё ж такі згубіла. Яе муж знік як нічога. Лепш скажы ёй, каб не пераймалася.

links.title: You: ""Hush, baby.""
links.english: "Hush, baby."
links.polish: „Już dobrze, dziecinko”.
links.belarusian: "Усё добра, дзетачка".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What?""
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: You: ""It's all right to not know where y..."
links.english: "It's all right to not know where your husband is. Nothing shameful in that."
links.polish: „To nic złego, nie wiedzieć, gdzie jest pani mąż. Nie ma powodu do wstydu”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта нічога дрэннага, не ведаць, дзе знаходзіцца ваш муж. Няма прычыны для сораму".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Who said anything about shame? Sto..."
links.english: "Who said anything about shame? Stop talking down to me." She puts her foot down. "My husband is not missing."
links.polish: „A kto tu mówi cokolwiek o wstydzie? Proszę przestać mówić do mnie w tym protekcjonalnym tonie” – tupie nogą. „Mój mąż nie zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "А хто тут гаворыць што-небудзь пра сорам? Калі ласка, перастаньце гаварыць са мной у гэтым патранавацьным тоне", — тупае нагой. "Мой муж не знік".

links.title: Inland Empire: "But he *is*... you can feel it. Or..."
links.english: But he *is*... you can feel it. Or maybe it's something else then!
links.polish: Ale przecież *zaginął*... czujesz to. A może to jednak nie to?
links.belarusian: Але ж *знік*... адчуваеш гэта. А можа, усё ж не тое?

links.title: You: ""No, I was talking to myself. I sho..."
links.english: "No, I was talking to myself. I should stop. It's okay."
links.polish: „Nie, mówiłem tylko do siebie. Powinienem przestać. Już dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я гаварыў толькі сам з сабою. Павінен перастаць. Ужо добра".

Alternate1.english: "No, I was talking to myself. I should hush. I'm a baby."
Alternate1.polish: „Nie, mówiłem tylko do siebie. Powinienem zamilknąć. Jestem jak dziecko”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Не, я гаварыў толькі з сабой. Паўсюль змаўкаць. Я як дзіця".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She tries to concentrate on books,..."
links.english: She tries to concentrate on books, but her eyes are full of bewilderment.
links.polish: Stara się skupić na książkach, ale jej spojrzenie jest pełne zdumienia.
links.belarusian: Яна стараецца засяродзіцца на кнігах, але яе погляд поўны здзіўлення.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Okay! Maybe it's something else the..."
links.english: Okay! Maybe it's something else then.
links.polish: No dobrze! Może to w takim razie co innego.
links.belarusian: Ну добра! Магчыма, гэта тады нешта іншае.

links.title: You: ""It's okay.""
links.english: "It's okay."
links.polish: „Już dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Ужо добра".

links.title: You: "Let go."
links.english: Let go.
links.polish: Odpuść.
links.belarusian: Адпусці.

links.title: Logic: "It's gotta be something else then...."
links.english: It's gotta be something else then. Why else would you be asking her if it wasn't?
links.polish: Musi zatem chodzić o coś innego. Inaczej po co miałbyś ją w ogóle pytać?
links.belarusian: Мусіць, тут ідзе гаворка пра нешта іншае. Інакш чаму б ты ўвогуле яе пытаў?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Kids are always going missing. Weak..."
links.english: Kids are always going missing. Weak, pathetic kids. Always getting themselves killed.
links.polish: Dzieciaki cały czas się gubią. Słabowite, żałosne dzieciaki. Co i rusz coś je zabija.
links.belarusian: Дзеці ўвесь час губляюцца. Слабаватыя, жаласныя дзеці. Што і раз іх нешта забівае.

links.title: You: ""Suit yourself then. I don't really..."
links.english: "Suit yourself then. I don't really care if your husband is missing."
links.polish: „Jak sobie pani chce. W sumie to mnie nie obchodzi, czy pani mąż zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "Як сабе хочаце. У прынцыпе, мяне не цікавіць, ці знік ваш муж".

links.title: You: ""Maybe you´re right. Maybe he isn't..."
links.english: "Maybe you´re right. Maybe he isn't missing indeed."
links.polish: „Może i ma pani rację. Może faktycznie nie zaginął”.
links.belarusian: "Можа, і вы маеце рацыю. Можа, насамрэч ён не знік".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Of course he's not. It's not like..."
links.english: "Of course he's not. It's not like he's a pocket watch. I wouldn't just lose him."
links.polish: „Oczywiście, że nie zaginął. Przecież to nie kieszonkowy zegarek. Nie zgubiłabym go”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома, што ён не знік. Гэта ж не кішэнны гадзіннік. Я б яго не згубіла".

links.title: You: ""Right, got it, thanks.""
links.english: "Right, got it, thanks."
links.polish: „Dobrze, rozumiem. Dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, разумею. Дзякуй".

links.title: You: ""Okay, thanks.""
links.english: "Okay, thanks."
links.polish: „Dobrze, dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, дзякуй".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhm. You're welcome." She reverts..."
links.english: "Mhm. You're welcome." She reverts her attention back to the book stand.
links.polish: „Mhm. Nie ma za co” – wraca do przeglądania książek.
links.belarusian: "Мгм. Няма за што" — вяртаецца да прагляду кніг.

links.title: You: ""Maybe your children are missing?""
links.english: "Maybe your children are missing?"
links.polish: „Może zaginęły pani dzieci?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, у вас зніклі дзеці?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No. Absolutely not." Her words com..."
links.english: "No. Absolutely not." Her words come out quick as gunshots.
links.polish: „Nie. Absolutnie nie” – wypowiada te słowa z szybkością karabinu.
links.belarusian: "Не. Абсалютна не", — вымаўляе гэтыя словы са хуткасцю кулямёта.

links.title: You: ""Okay. So where are they?""
links.english: "Okay. So where are they?"
links.polish: „Dobrze. Gdzie zatem są?”
links.belarusian: "Добра. Дзе яны тады?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Are you a police man or a nanny?"..."
links.english: "Are you a police man or a nanny?" She's definitely disturbed by now.
links.polish: „Jest pan policjantem czy niańką?” – jest zdecydowanie poruszona.
links.belarusian: "Вы паліцэйскі ці нянька?" — відавочна хвалюецца яна.

links.title: You: ""Nanny. Where are they?""
links.english: "Nanny. Where are they?"
links.polish: „Niańką. Gdzie one są?”
links.belarusian: "Нянькай. Дзе яны?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""They're not missing, sir.""
links.english: "They're not missing, sir."
links.polish: „One nie zaginęły”.
links.belarusian: "Яны не зніклі".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You know where they are. They're at..."
links.english: You know where they are. They're at home. *Smoking*. Giving the ladder of vices a chance.
links.polish: Wiesz, gdzie są. W domu. I *palą*. Wspinają się po drabince występków.
links.belarusian: Ведаеш, дзе яны. Дома. І *паліць*. Узбіраюцца па лесвіцы парушэнняў.

links.title: Inland Empire: "What if something horrible has happ..."
links.english: What if something horrible has happened? What if they're dead. That's the bad vibe you got before.
links.polish: A co jeśli stało się coś okropnego? Jeśli na przykład nie żyją. To właśnie to złe przeczucie, które miałeś wcześniej.
links.belarusian: А што, калі здарылася нешта жудаснае? Калі, напрыклад, яны не жывуць. Гэта тое самае дрэннае прадчуванне, якое ты меў раней.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No, they're at a disco. Getting dow..."
links.english: No, they're at a disco. Getting down. Stupid disco dancing teenagers.
links.polish: Nie, są na dyskotece. Szaleją. Głupie, tańczące do disco nastolatki.
links.belarusian: Не, яны на дыскатэцы. Шалеюць. Дурныя, танцуючыя да дыскатэкі падлеткі.

links.title: You: ""They are at home, right? Smoking c..."
links.english: "They are at home, right? Smoking cigarettes."
links.polish: „Są w domu, prawda? I palą papierosy”.
links.belarusian: "Яны дома, праўда? І паляць цыгарэты".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What? That's just -- my daughters..."
links.english: "What? That's just -- my daughters are perfectly *fine*. They're with their friends down in Jamrock! There's *nothing* to worry about."
links.polish: „Co? Nie no... Moje córki mają się *dobrze*. Są ze swoimi przyjaciółmi w Jamrock! Nie ma *żadnych* powodów do zmartwień”.
links.belarusian: "Што? Не, ну... Мая дочкі ў іх *усё добра*. Яны з сябрамі ў Джамроку! Няма *ніякіх* прычын для турботы".

links.title: Empathy: "She's getting upset. Her voice has..."
links.english: She's getting upset. Her voice has risen, as she tries to convince herself that her daughters are safe.
links.polish: Ogarnia ją gniew. Podniosła głos, próbując przekonać samą siebie, że jej córkom nic nie grozi.
links.belarusian: Яе ахапіў гнеў. Яна падняла голас, спрабуючы пераканаць саму сябе, што яе дочкам нічога не пагражае.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""They're almost grown up now anyway..."
links.english: "They're almost grown up now anyway. They're past the age they need me protecting them from everything now."
links.polish: „Są prawie dorosłe. Dawno już nie są w wieku, w którym trzeba je było przed wszystkim chronić”.
links.belarusian: "Яны амаль дарослыя. Даўно ўжо не ў такім узросце, каб іх трэба было ад усяго абараняць".

links.title: Half Light: "What is this *doubt* you have then?..."
links.english: What is this *doubt* you have then? Something *has* happened here.
links.polish: Cóż zatem czujesz za *wątpliwość*? Coś się tutaj *wydarzyło*.
links.belarusian: Што ж, адчуваеш *сумненні*? Нешта тут *адбылося*.

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid the danger is now great..."
links.english: "I'm afraid the danger is now greater than ever. Tell me, how old are they?"
links.polish: „Niestety, zagrożenie jest obecnie większe niż kiedykolwiek. Proszę powiedzieć, ile mają lat?”
links.belarusian: "На жаль, пагроза зараз большая, чым калі-небудзь. Скажыце, калі ласка, колькі ім гадоў?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""My youngest girl, Jolie, is just s..."
links.english: "My youngest girl, Jolie, is just shy of sixteen. Jennie, she is turning eighteen next month. But we shouldn't even be talking about them!"
links.polish: „Moja najmłodsza córka, Jolie, ma prawie szesnaście. Jennie skończy osiemnaście za miesiąc. Ale nie powinniśmy nawet o nich rozmawiać!”
links.belarusian: "Мая самая малодшая дачка, Джолі, мае амаль шаснаццаць. Джэні споўніцца васямнаццаць праз месяц. Але мы нават не павінны аб іх гаварыць!"

links.title: You: ""And can you describe me their appe..."
links.english: "And can you describe me their appearance? Any features that stand out, something to make identifying a little easier?"
links.polish: „A może mi pani opisać ich wygląd? Wszelkie cechy szczególne, coś, co ułatwiłoby ich rozpoznanie?”
links.belarusian: "А можаце апісаць іх знешнасць? Усе адметныя рысы, нешта, што дапамагло б іх распазнаць?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Why do you need to know this? Have..."
links.english: "Why do you need to know this? Haven't I repeatedly told you that they are not missing? That they're in Jamrock, safe and well, at some stupid party."
links.polish: „Po co to panu? Ile razy mam powtarzać, że one nie zaginęły? Że są w Jamrock, całe i zdrowe na jakiejś głupiej imprezie”.
links.belarusian: "Для чаго гэта вам? Колькі разоў мне трэба паўтараць, што яны не зніклі? Што яны ў Джамроку, цэлыя і здаровыя на якой-небудзь дурной вечарыне".

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Did someone say... party? You could..."
links.english: Did someone say... party? You could use a party. Hunt it down!
links.polish: Czy ktoś powiedział... „impreza”? Przydałaby ci się jedna. Znajdź ją!
links.belarusian: Ці хтось сказаў... "вечарына"? Табе б не перашкодзіла адна. Знайдзі яе!

links.title: You: ""I could do with a party.. A *kille..."
links.english: "I could do with a party.. A *killer* party, not a lame-o one!"
links.polish: „Impreza to by mi się przydała. *Zabójcza* impreza, nie jakaś lamerska!”
links.belarusian: "Вечарынка мне б не зашкодзіла. *Забойная* вечарынка, а не нейкая ламерская!"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""A 'killer' party? What is it with..."
links.english: "A 'killer' party? What is it with you and *pulp* staples? My god. Please, no more talk about my daughters. They are fine!" She picks up a book and tries to concentrate. A flock of seabirds passes by.
links.polish: „»Zabójcza impreza«? Musi być pan taki *sztampowy*? Dobry boże. Błagam, nie mówmy już o moich córkach. Nic im nie jest!” – podnosi książkę i próbuje się na niej skupić. W pobliżu przelatuje stado morskich ptaków.
links.belarusian: ""Забойная вечарына"? Ці абавязкова вы павінны быць такі *банальны*? Божа мой. Калі ласка, не гаварыце больш пра маіх дачок. З імі ўсё добра!" – падымае кнігу і спрабуе засяродзіцца на ёй. Побач пралятае стайка марскіх птушак.

links.title: Logic: "Okay. It must be asked then -- what..."
links.english: Okay. It must be asked then -- what *are* you doing here? Why are you pursuing this? Is it a *hunch*?
links.polish: Dobrze, w takim razie trzeba zadać to pytanie: co ty tu *robisz*? Czemu tak naciskasz? Czy to *przeczucie*?
links.belarusian: Добра, у такім разе трэба задаць гэтае пытанне: што ты тут *робіш*? Чаму так націскаеш? Ці гэта *прадчуванне*?

links.title: You: ""It's for the investigation. I'm tr..."
links.english: "It's for the investigation. I'm trying to be professional."
links.polish: „To na potrzeby śledztwa. Staram się być profesjonalistą”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта для патрэб следства. Я імкнуся быць прафесіяналам".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""There is no *investigation* here,..."
links.english: "There is no *investigation* here, I can tell you that!" She picks up a book and tries to concentrate. A flock of seabirds passes by.
links.polish: „Nie ma żadnego *śledztwa*, mówię to panu!” – podnosi książkę i próbuje się na niej skupić. W pobliżu przelatuje stado morskich ptaków.
links.belarusian: "Няма ніякага *следства*, кажу вам!" — падымае кнігу і спрабуе на ёй засяродзіцца. Побач пралятае статак марскіх птушак.

links.title: You: ""You're right, let's not talk about..."
links.english: "You're right, let's not talk about your daughters. I don't know what got into me."
links.polish: „Ma pani rację, nie rozmawiajmy o pani córkach. Nie wiem, co we mnie wstąpiło”.
links.belarusian: "Вы маеце рацыю, не будзем размаўляць пра вашых дачок. Не ведаю, што на мяне найшло".

links.title: You: ""Maybe you're right. Maybe they are..."
links.english: "Maybe you're right. Maybe they aren't missing after all. Tell me something else..."
links.polish: „Może i ma pani rację. Może jednak nie zaginęły. Proszę mi jeszcze powiedzieć...”
links.belarusian: "Можа, вы маеце рацыю. А можа, яны не зніклі. Скажыце мне яшчэ..."

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmh?" She adjusts her scarf, cheek..."
links.english: "Hmh?" She adjusts her scarf, cheeks rough and ruddy from the wind.
links.polish: „Hm?” – poprawia swój szalik, osłaniając ogorzałe od wiatru policzki.
links.belarusian: "Гм?" — папраўляе свой шалік, прыкрываючы шчокі, абгарэлыя ад ветру.

links.title: You: ""I know where they are. At the disc..."
links.english: "I know where they are. At the disco, dancing nasty."
links.polish: „Wiem, gdzie są. Na dyskotece. I lubieżnie tańczą”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаю, дзе яны. На дыскатэцы. І распусна танчаць".

links.title: You: ""What if something awful has happen..."
links.english: "What if something awful has happened... what if they're in the sewers."
links.polish: „A co jeśli stało się coś okropnego... i są teraz w kanałach?”
links.belarusian: "А што, калі здарылася нешта жахлівае... і яны зараз у каналізацыях?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, great. Just making sure.""
links.english: "Okay, great. Just making sure."
links.polish: „Dobrze, świetnie. Upewniam się tylko”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, выдатна. Проста ўпэўніваюся".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhm, I see. Thanks." She tries to..."
links.english: "Mhm, I see. Thanks." She tries to read again.
links.polish: „Mhm, rozumiem. Dzięki” – odpowiada i próbuje wrócić do czytania.
links.belarusian: "Мгм, разумею. Дзякуй", — адказвае і спрабуе вярнуцца да чытання.

links.title: You: ""I police whatever I want. Where ar..."
links.english: "I police whatever I want. Where are they?"
links.polish: „Policjantem, który zajmuje się, czym chce. Gdzie one są?”
links.belarusian: "Паліцэйскі, які займаецца тым, чым хоча. Дзе яны?"

links.title: You: ""Right, thanks.""
links.english: "Right, thanks."
links.polish: „Dobrze. Dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Добра. Дзякуй".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She gives you a short nod and shift..."
links.english: She gives you a short nod and shifts her attention back to books.
links.polish: Kiwa głową, po czym znowu skupia się na książkach.
links.belarusian: Ківае галавой, пасля чаго зноў засяроджваецца на кнігах.

links.title: You: ""Maybe your *cockatoo* is missing?""
links.english: "Maybe your *cockatoo* is missing?"
links.polish: „Może zaginęła pani *kakadu*?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, у пані знікла *какаду*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I don't mean to disrespect, sir, b..."
links.english: "I don't mean to disrespect, sir, but *you* are being a bit of a cockatoo here."
links.polish: „Z całym szacunkiem, ale to *pan* zachowuje się trochę jak kakadu”.
links.belarusian: "З усёй павагай, але гэта *вы* паводзіце сябе крыху як какаду".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For what it's worth -- I agree. Bu..."
links.english: "For what it's worth -- I agree. But cockatoos can't be stopped when they get like this. It's better to indulge him at this point."
links.polish: „Właściwie się z panią zgadzam. Ale kakadu w takim stanie nie sposób powstrzymać. Lepiej mu po prostu ulec”.
links.belarusian: "Увогуле, я з вамі згодны. Але какату ў такім стане нельга стрымаць. Лепш проста саступіць яму".

links.title: You: ""Ma'am, I was asking about your coc..."
links.english: "Ma'am, I was asking about your cockatoo. Is it missing?"
links.polish: „Proszę pani, pytałem o pani kakadu. Zaginęła?”
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, спадарыня, я запытаў пра вашага какаду. Знік?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I don't even have a cockatoo. And..."
links.english: "I don't even have a cockatoo. And guess what?"
links.polish: „Nie posiadam nawet kakadu. I wie pan co?”
links.belarusian: "Я нават какаду не маю. І ведаеце што?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's a trap. Never ever say *what*."
links.english: It's a trap. Never ever say *what*.
links.polish: To pułapka. Przenigdy, nigdy nie mów „*co*”.
links.belarusian: Гэта пастка. Ніколі, ніколі не кажыце "*што*".

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Even if I had, it wouldn't be miss..."
links.english: "Even if I had, it wouldn't be missing."
links.polish: „Nawet gdybym miała, to by mi nie zaginęła”.
links.belarusian: "Нават калі б я яе мела, яна не знікла б".

links.title: You: ""Alright, cockatoo not missing. I j..."
links.english: "Alright, cockatoo not missing. I just wanted to make sure."
links.polish: „Dobrze, czyli kakadu nie zaginęła. Chciałem się tylko upewnić”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, значыць, какаду не згубілася. Я проста хацеў пераканацца".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Great." She turns her attention ba..."
links.english: "Great." She turns her attention back to the bookstand.
links.polish: „Świetnie” – wraca do przeglądania książek.
links.belarusian: "Выдатна" — вяртаецца да прагляду кніг.

links.title: You: ""Just one more question: what did y..."
links.english: "Just one more question: what did you mean by me being a cockatoo?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze tylko jedno pytanie: co pani miała na myśli, mówiąc, że zachowuję się jak kakadu?”
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ толькі адно пытанне: што вы мелі на ўвазе, калі казалі, што я паводжу сябе, як какаду?"

links.title: You: ""Great. Got it.""
links.english: "Great. Got it."
links.polish: „Świetnie. Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Выдатна. Я разумею".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Wonderful.""
links.english: "Wonderful."
links.polish: „Cudownie”.
links.belarusian: "Цудоўна".

links.title: You: ""What do you mean I'm being a cocka..."
links.english: "What do you mean I'm being a cockatoo?"
links.polish: „Jak to zachowuję się jak kakadu?”
links.belarusian: "Як гэта я сябе паводжу як какаду?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Nothing. Go read up on them if you..."
links.english: "Nothing. Go read up on them if you're so interested. There's a great book in the bookstore."
links.polish: „Nie miałam nic złego na myśli. Proszę poczytać o nich, jeśli tak to pana interesuje. W księgarni mają świetną książkę na ten temat”.
links.belarusian: "Я нічога дрэннага не мела на ўвазе. Калі вас гэта цікавіць, прачытайце пра іх. У кнігарні ёсць выдатная кніга на гэтую тэму".

links.title: Inland Empire: "Maybe you should check that cockato..."
links.english: Maybe you should check that cockatoo book again... What if the cockatoo is your *heraldic bird*?
links.polish: Może powinieneś jeszcze raz zajrzeć do tej książki o kakadu... Co jeśli to twój *ptak heraldyczny*?
links.belarusian: Можа, табе варта яшчэ раз паглядзець у гэтую кнігу пра какаду... Што, калі гэта твой *геральдычны птах*?

links.title: You: ""Actually, that's exactly what I'm..."
links.english: "Actually, that's exactly what I'm going to do, thanks for the tip." (Get task.)
links.polish: „Właściwie to chyba dokładnie tak zrobię, dziękuję za podpowiedź”. (Przyjmij zadanie).
links.belarusian: "На самой справе, напэўна, я зраблю менавіта так, дзякуй за падказку". (Прымай заданне).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Wonderful. The store is open.""
links.english: "Wonderful. The store is open."
links.polish: „Wspaniale. Księgarnia jest otwarta”.
links.belarusian: "Цудоўна. Кнігарня адчынена".

links.title: You: ""You're being sarcastic. Let's talk..."
links.english: "You're being sarcastic. Let's talk about something else." (Move on.)
links.polish: „Ten sarkazm nie jest potrzebny. Porozmawiajmy o czym innym”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Гэты сарказм не патрэбны. Давайце пагаворым пра нешта іншае". (Скончыць).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Please, let's do.""
links.english: "Please, let's do."
links.polish: „Tak, zmieńmy temat”.
links.belarusian: "Так, давайце зменім тэму".

links.title: Inland Empire: "Maybe you should... What if the coc..."
links.english: Maybe you should... What if the cockatoo is your *astral captain*? Or your *heraldic bird*?
links.polish: Może powinieneś? A jeśli kakadu to twoje *astralne zwierzę*? Albo *ptak heraldyczny*?
links.belarusian: Можа, ты павінен? А калі какаду — гэта тваё *астральнае жывёла*? Або *геральдычная птушка*?

links.title: You: "Watch her browse books."
links.english: Watch her browse books.
links.polish: Patrz, jak przegląda książki.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі, як ён праглядае кнігі.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "Her hands move over the book covers..."
links.english: Her hands move over the book covers. The tips of her fingers look rough, stained with yellow. It seems like she has spent a lot of time at work, smoking.
links.polish: Jej dłonie przesuwają się po okładkach książek. Koniuszki palców są szorstkie i zżółknięte. Zdaje się, że spędza wiele czasu w pracy – paląc papierosy.
links.belarusian: Яе рукі прасоўваюцца па вокладках кніг. Канцы пальцаў шурпатыя і пажоўклыя. Здаецца, яна шмат часу праводзіць на працы — курыць цыгарэты.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Another comrade! Years of labour ar..."
links.english: Another comrade! Years of labour are pressing down on her shoulders. She deserves a hug -- for all the work she's done for mankind.
links.polish: Kolejna towarzyszka! Na jej barkach ciążą lata trudnej pracy. Zasługuje na przytulenie za cały trud, jakiego podjęła się dla ludzkości.
links.belarusian: Яшчэ адна таварышка! На яе плячах цяжараць гады цяжкай працы. Яна заслугоўвае абдымкаў за ўсю цяжкую працу, якую прыняла для чалавецтва.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "An array of neurons fires up with j..."
links.english: An array of neurons fires up with joy. Bum her a cigarette -- lest it turn to pain.
links.polish: Twoje neurony aktywują się radośnie. Wysęp od niej papierosa, zanim euforia zmieni się w ból.
links.belarusian: Твае нейроны радасна актывізуюцца. Папрасі ў яе цыгарэту, перш чым эйфарыя зменіцца болем.

links.title: You: ""Do you have any money?""
links.english: "Do you have any money?"
links.polish: „Ma pani jakieś pieniądze?”
links.belarusian: "Ці ёсць у Вас нейкія грошы?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Money?" She looks up to you, a con..."
links.english: "Money?" She looks up to you, a confused smile crossing her lips. "Does the working class ever have any money?"
links.polish: „Pieniądze?” – pyta, spoglądając na ciebie ze speszonym uśmiechem. „Czy klasa pracująca ma jakieś pieniądze?”
links.belarusian: "Грошы?" – пытаецца, паглядаючы на вас з няўпэўненай усмешкай. "Ці ў рабочага класа ёсць якія-небудзь грошы?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "She starts coughing. It's definitel..."
links.english: She starts coughing. It's definitely a smoker's cough.
links.polish: Zaczyna kasłać. To ewidentnie kaszel palaczki.
links.belarusian: Пачынае кашляць. Гэта відавочна кашаль курыльшчыцы.

links.title: You: ""You're right, I should find myself..."
links.english: "You're right, I should find myself a *capitalist*!"
links.polish: „Racja, powinienem znaleźć jakiegoś *kapitalistę*!”
links.belarusian: "Праўда, я павінен знайсці якога-небудзь *капіталіста*!"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhmh. Exactly. Go ask for an inves..."
links.english: "Mhmh. Exactly. Go ask for an investment." Her words are clipped, but not unamused. Her eyes turn back to the book stand.
links.polish: „Mhm. Zgadza się. Proszę poszukać inwestora” – jej odpowiedź jest krótka, ale nie pozbawiona rozbawienia. Wraca do przeglądania książek.
links.belarusian: "Мгм. Праўда. Калі ласка, пашукайце інвестара" — яе адказ кароткі, але не пазбаўлены весялосці. Яна вяртаецца да прагляду кніг.

links.title: You: ""I wasn't thinking much, maybe like..."
links.english: "I wasn't thinking much, maybe like a few cents or so?"
links.polish: „Nie musi być wiele, może chociaż kilka centów?”
links.belarusian: "Не павінна быць шмат, можа хоць некалькі цэнтаў?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, sorry," she puts her hands int..."
links.english: "No, sorry," she puts her hands into her coat pockets, as if cold from wind. "I don't have anything to spare."
links.polish: „Nie, przykro mi” – odpowiada, wkładając ręce do kieszeni swojego płaszcza, jakby chciała je ochronić przed zimnym wiatrem. „Nie mam pieniędzy, którymi mogłabym się podzielić”.
links.belarusian: "Не, мне шкада", – адказвае яна, кладучы рукі ў кішэні свайго паліто, нібы хоча абараніць іх ад халоднага ветру. "У мяне няма грошай, якімі магла б падзяліцца".

links.title: You: ""So your *money* is *missing*?""
links.english: "So your *money* is *missing*?"
links.polish: „A więc *zaginęły* pani *pieniądze*?”
links.belarusian: "Дык *зніклі* вашы *грошы*?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No! No-no-no. I'm not missing my m..."
links.english: "No! No-no-no. I'm not missing my money. End of story." She returns her attention back to the book stand.
