links.polish: „Nie! Nie, nie, nie. Nie zaginęły mi żadne pieniądze. Koniec tematu” – wraca do przeglądania książek.
links.belarusian: "Не! Не, не, не. Мне не знікалі ніякія грошы. Канец тэмы" — вяртаецца да прагляду кніг.

links.title: You: ""Sad. I'll bum somebody else then.""
links.english: "Sad. I'll bum somebody else then."
links.polish: „Szkoda. No nic, pójdę sępić u kogoś innego”.
links.belarusian: "Шкода. Ну нічога, пайду прасіць у кагосьці іншага".

links.title: You: ""Do you smoke?""
links.english: "Do you smoke?"
links.polish: „Pali pani?”
links.belarusian: "Палі пані?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I don't.""
links.english: "No, I don't."
links.polish: „Nie, nie palę”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я не палю".

links.title: You: ""I know for a fact that you smoke.""
links.english: "I know for a fact that you smoke."
links.polish: „Wiem na pewno, że pani pali”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю напэўна, што пані курыць".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Why do you think that I smoke?" Sh..."
links.english: "Why do you think that I smoke?" She looks up, slightly startled.
links.polish: „Skąd to przekonanie, że palę?” – podnosi wzrok, lekko przestraszona.
links.belarusian: "Адкуль гэтае перакананне, што я кура?" – падымае позірк, крыху напалоханая.

links.title: You: ""That cough you had. It's a smoker'..."
links.english: "That cough you had. It's a smoker's cough."
links.polish: „Ten pani kaszel... to kaszel palaczki”.
links.belarusian: "Гэты кашаль... гэта кашаль курыльшчыцы".

links.title: Working Class Woman: "Her eyes shimmer over yours. "You'r..."
links.english: Her eyes shimmer over yours. "You're a keen observer," she remarks.
links.polish: Jej wzrok spotyka się z twoim. „Jest pan uważnym obserwatorem” – stwierdza.
links.belarusian: Яе позір сустракаецца з вашым. "Вы ўважлівы назіральнік" — адзначае яна.

links.title: You: ""Just give me a cigarette please.""
links.english: "Just give me a cigarette please."
links.polish: „Proszę, niech mi pani po prostu da papierosa”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, проста дайце мне цыгарэту".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I already told you -- I don't have..."
links.english: "I already told you -- I don't have any. Go bother someone else."
links.polish: „Już mówiłam, że nie mam. Niech pan znajdzie sobie kogoś innego do dokuczania”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўжо сказала, што не маю. Знайдзіце сабе кагосьці іншага, каб дакучаць".

links.title: Half Light: "She's lying. She's god damn lying,..."
links.english: She's lying. She's god damn lying, she has smokes!
links.polish: Kłamie. Kłamie jak cholera. Ma fajki!
links.belarusian: Хлусіць. Хлусіць як чорт. Мае цыгарэты!

links.title: You: ""Just one, I beg you. Just one. GIV..."
links.english: "Just one, I beg you. Just one. GIVE ME THE DAMN CIGARETTE, MA'AM!"
links.polish: „Tylko jednego. Błagam. Jednego. NIECHŻE MI PANI DA TEGO CHOLERNEGO PAPIEROSA!”
links.belarusian: "Толькі аднаго. Маліць. Аднаго. ДАЙЦЕ МНЕ ГЭТУ ПРАКЛЯТУЮ ЦЫГАРЭТУ!"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I can't give you what I don't have..."
links.english: "I can't give you what I don't have." She turns away from you, focusing on the books again.
links.polish: „Nie mogę dać czegoś, czego nie mam” – odpowiada i odwraca się od ciebie, aby znowu skupić się na książkach.
links.belarusian: "Я не магу даць тое, чаго ў мяне няма", — адказвае і адвяртаецца ад цябе, каб зноў сканцэнтравацца на кнігах.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs."
links.english: The lieutenant sighs.
links.polish: Porucznik wzdycha.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант уздыхае.

links.title: You: ""I *know* you're lying, please just..."
links.english: "I *know* you're lying, please just give me a cigarette."
links.polish: „*Wiem*, że pani kłamie. Proszę po prostu dać mi papierosa”.
links.belarusian: "*Ведаю*, што вы маніце. Будзьце ласкавы, проста дайце мне цыгарэту".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, I'm not lying. Why should I li..."
links.english: "No, I'm not lying. Why should I lie?" A pause. "Please go to the Frittte kiosk."
links.polish: „Nie, nie kłamię. Po co miałabym kłamać?” – przez chwilę milczy. „Proszę pójść do Frittte”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не ілгу. Навошта мне ілгаць?" – на хвіліну маўчыць. "Калі ласка, ідзіце да Фрыце".

links.title: Half Light: "You'd lie too, wouldn't you? You'd..."
links.english: You'd lie too, wouldn't you? You'd lie and steal and cheat! Ask her again, squeeze the truth out of her. Keep pressing. Ask, ask, *ask*!
links.polish: Ty też byś kłamał, nie? Kłamałbyś, kradł i oszukiwał! Spytaj ją znowu, wyciśnij z niej prawdę. Naciskaj dalej. Pytaj! Pytaj! *Pytaj*!
links.belarusian: Ты таксама б падманваў, не? Падманваў бы, краў і ашукваў! Спытай яе зноў, выцісні з яе праўду. Цісні далей. Пытайся! Пытайся! *Пытайся*!

links.title: You: ""Just gimme your cigarettes, okay?..."
links.english: "Just gimme your cigarettes, okay? Don't lie."
links.polish: „Po prostu proszę mi dać papierosy, dobra? A nie kłamać”.
links.belarusian: "Проста прашу мне даць цыгарэты, добра? А не хлусіць".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Sorry, officer?" She stares at you..."
links.english: "Sorry, officer?" She stares at you in disbelief.
links.polish: „Co proszę, panie policjancie?” – przygląda ci się z niedowierzaniem.
links.belarusian: "Што, прашу, пане паліцыянце?" — глядзіць на цябе з недаверам.

links.title: Half Light: "SHE'S LYING, LYING, LYING!"
links.english: SHE'S LYING, LYING, LYING!
links.polish: ONA KŁAMIE! KŁAMIE! KŁAMIE!
links.belarusian: ЯНА ХЛУШЫЦЬ! ХЛУШЫЦЬ! ХЛУШЫЦЬ!

links.title: You: ""Do you know where I could get a ne..."
links.english: "Do you know where I could get a new pack?"
links.polish: „Wie pani, gdzie mogę kupić nową paczkę?”
links.belarusian: "Ці ведаеце вы, дзе я магу набыць новы пакет?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""From the kiosk? There's one near t..."
links.english: "From the kiosk? There's one near the harbour, it's a Frittte. You can look it up."
links.polish: „W kiosku? W pobliżu portu jest jeden – to Frittte. Niech go pan poszuka”.
links.belarusian: "У кіёску? Побач з портам ёсць адзін – гэта Фрыттэ. Няхай спадар яго паспрабуе знайсці".

links.title: You: ""Okay, thanks, no problem." (Move o..."
links.english: "Okay, thanks, no problem." (Move on.)
links.polish: „Dobrze, dziękuję, nie ma sprawy”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Добра, дзякуй, няма праблем". (Скончыць).

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She sighs."
links.english: She sighs.
links.polish: Wzdycha.
links.belarusian: Ўздыхае.

links.title: You: ""It's the kind of place where every..."
links.english: "It's the kind of place where everyone does."
links.polish: „To typ miejsca, w którym palą wszyscy”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта тып месца, дзе кураць усе".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""You're right, we do smoke worse th..."
links.english: "You're right, we do smoke worse than chimneys here."
links.polish: „Ma pan rację, kopcimy tutaj gorzej niż kominy”.
links.belarusian: "Вы маеце рацыю, тут капцім горш, чым коміны".

links.title: You: ""I suspect I may possess supra-natu..."
links.english: "I suspect I may possess supra-natural abilities."
links.polish: „Tak sobie myślę, że być może posiadam nadnaturalne moce”.
links.belarusian: "Так сабе думаю, што, магчыма, валодаю звышнатуральнымі сіламі".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""No, you don't." She puts her hands..."
links.english: "No, you don't." She puts her hands into her coat pockets.
links.polish: „Nie, nie posiada pan” – wkłada dłonie do kieszeni swojego płaszcza.
links.belarusian: "Не, вы не маеце" — кладзе рукі ў кішэні свайго плашча.

links.title: You: ""Your hands look like they belong t..."
links.english: "Your hands look like they belong to a heavy smoker."
links.polish: „Ma pani dłonie nałogowej palaczki”.
links.belarusian: "У вас рукі заядлай курыльшчыцы".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's not like yours look much bett..."
links.english: "It's not like yours look much better," she says while eyeing yours.
links.polish: „Pańskie nie wyglądają wcale lepiej” – odpowiada, przyglądając się im.
links.belarusian: "Вашыя таксама не выглядаюць лепш", – адказвае ён, аглядаючы іх.

links.title: You: "Take a look at your hands."
links.english: Take a look at your hands.
links.polish: Spójrz na swoje dłonie.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на свае рукі.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She is right -- your hands look eve..."
links.english: She is right -- your hands look even worse than hers, with tiny cuts and gushes covering your skin like a spiderweb. Your fingertips have become an ugly shade of brown.
links.polish: Ma rację. Twoje dłonie wyglądają jeszcze gorzej niż jej – pokrywa je pajęcza sieć maleńkich rozcięć i ranek. Czubki palców przybrały okropny, brązowawy odcień.
links.belarusian: Ён мае рацыю. Твае рукі выглядаюць яшчэ горш, чым яе — іх пакрываюць павуціны маленькіх парэзаў і раны. Канцы пальцаў набылі жудасны, карычняваты адценне.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "These are the hands on someone who'..."
links.english: These are the hands on someone who's smoked for at least twenty years, as evidenced by the discolouration of fingers. Marks on your skin may point to past quarrels.
links.polish: To dłonie kogoś, kto pali od co najmniej dwudziestu lat – dowodzi tego odbarwienie palców. Ślady na twoich rękach mogą świadczyć o dawnych kłótniach.
links.belarusian: Гэта рукі кагосьці, хто паліць прынамсі дваццаць гадоў – знефарбоўванне пальцаў сведчыць пра гэта. Сляды на тваіх руках могуць сведчыць пра даўнія сваркі.

links.title: You: ""Alright, got it, thanks.""
links.english: "Alright, got it, thanks."
links.polish: „Dobrze, rozumiem. Dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, разумею. Дзякуй".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhmh." She returns to her book."
links.english: "Mhmh." She returns to her book.
links.polish: „Mhm” – odpowiada i wraca do swojej książki.
links.belarusian: "Мгм" — адказвае і вяртаецца да сваёй кнігі.

links.title: You: "Give her a hug."
links.english: Give her a hug.
links.polish: Przytul ją.
links.belarusian: Абдымі яе.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "You step in and close your arms aro..."
links.english: You step in and close your arms around this foreign body, wandering astray in touch. There's a small movement beneath your hands, as you shut your eyes. Then a tiny voice breaks out and asks:
links.polish: Podchodzisz do niej i otaczasz ramionami to obce ciało, błądząc po nim dłońmi. Gdy zamykasz oczy, czujesz pod dłońmi niewielki ruch. Po chwili ciszę przerywa niepewny głosik:
links.belarusian: Ты падыходзіш да яе і ахутваеш рукамі гэта чужое цела, блукаючы па ім рукамі. Калі закрываеш вочы, адчуваеш пад рукамі невялікі рух. Праз імгненне цішыню перапыняе няўпэўнены галасок:

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What is happening?""
links.english: "What is happening?"
links.polish: „Co się dzieje?”
links.belarusian: "Што адбываецца?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She seems to be confused. Your hand..."
links.english: She seems to be confused. Your hands are wrapped around her polyester coat. The fabric feels cold, moist from the sea nearby.
links.polish: Jest zdezorientowana. Twoje ręce obejmują jej poliestrowy płaszcz. Materiał jest zimny w dotyku i wilgotny od morskiej bryzy.
links.belarusian: Яна разгубленая. Вашыя рукі абдымаюць яе паліестравае паліто. Матэрыял халодны навобмацак і вільготны ад марскога ветру.

links.title: You: "Keep hugging her."
links.english: Keep hugging her.
links.polish: Przytulaj ją dalej.
links.belarusian: Абдымай яе далей.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The situation is oddly intimate --..."
links.english: The situation is oddly intimate -- your cheek is pressed against her shoulder, her hand is trapped between your chest. Five seconds pass and their passing seems so unimaginably long. Then she coughs and says again:
links.polish: Sytuacja jest dziwnie intymna – twój policzek jest przyciśnięty do jej ramienia, jej ręka uwięziona między nią a twoją piersią. Niewyobrażalnie wolno mija pięć sekund, po czym kaszle i znowu się odzywa:
links.belarusian: Сітуацыя дзіўна інтымная – твая шчака прыціснута да яе пляча, яе рука заціснута паміж ёй і тваёй грудной клеткай. Неверагодна марудна мінае пяць секунд, пасля чаго яна кашляе і зноў загаворвае:

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Uh... what are you doing, officer?""
links.english: "Uh... what are you doing, officer?"
links.polish: „Ee... Co pan robi, panie policjancie?”
links.belarusian: "Ээ... Што вы робіце, спадар паліцыянт?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Less talk, more feeling. Keep your..."
links.english: Less talk, more feeling. Keep your eyes closed, soak in the closeness. See what the feeling entails.
links.polish: Mniej gadania, więcej odczuwania. Nie otwieraj oczu, napawaj się bliskością. Myśl, co niesie to uczucie.
links.belarusian: Менш гаворкі, больш адчування. Не адчыняй вочы, атрымай асалоду ад блізкасці. Думай, што нясе гэтае пачуццё.

links.title: You: "Keep your eyes closed for a brief l..."
links.english: Keep your eyes closed for a brief longer.
links.polish: Nie otwieraj oczu jeszcze przez krótką chwilę.
links.belarusian: Не ўздзірай вачэй яшчэ на кароткі момант.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The feeling continues. Warm and com..."
links.english: The feeling continues. Warm and comfy on the cold shoreline. You hear a question rising to the surface, trying to break the sensation.
links.polish: Uczucie trwa. Ciepło i odprężenie na zimnym wybrzeżu. Czujesz, jak na powierzchnię twojej świadomości wypływa pytanie. Próbuje zburzyć ten błogostan.
links.belarusian: Адчуванне захоўваецца. Цяпло і расслабленасць на халодным ўзбярэжжы. Адчуваеш, як на паверхню тваёй свядомасці выплывае пытанне. Яно спрабуе парушыць гэты блажэнства.

links.title: You: "Let it form."
links.english: Let it form.
links.polish: Pozwól mu się ukształtować.
links.belarusian: Дай яму сфармавацца.

links.title: Inland Empire: "So tell me, how does it feel -- to..."
links.english: So tell me, how does it feel -- to be close to someone, skin to skin?
links.polish: To powiedz, jak to jest, czuć czyjąś skórę na swojej?
links.belarusian: То скажы, як гэта - адчуваць чыюсьці скуру на сваёй?

links.title: You: "It all comes together now. I was bu..."
links.english: It all comes together now. I was built to be close with other beings.
links.polish: Wszystko składa się w całość. Powstałem, aby być blisko innych istot.
links.belarusian: Усё складаецца ў адно цэлае. Я створаны, каб быць блізка да іншых істот.

links.title: You: "It's good, but I'd prefer a man. A..."
links.english: It's good, but I'd prefer a man. A solid muscularity would support me better.
links.polish: Miło, ale wolałbym mężczyznę. Mocne mięśnie lepiej by mnie podtrzymały.
links.belarusian: Прыемна, але я аддаў бы перавагу мужчыне. Моцныя мышцы лепш падтрымалі б мяне.

links.title: You: "Intimacy? It's a catastrophe waitin..."
links.english: Intimacy? It's a catastrophe waiting in the wings.
links.polish: Intymność? To czekająca na swój moment katastrofa.
links.belarusian: Інтымнасць? Гэта катастрофа, якая чакае свайго моманту.

links.title: You: "Silence your thoughts. I don't want..."
links.english: Silence your thoughts. I don't want to answer anything.
links.polish: Ucisz swoje myśli. Nie chcę odpowiadać na żadne pytania.
links.belarusian: Сціш свае думкі. Я не хачу адказваць на ніякія пытанні.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You focus on the hug and for a mome..."
links.english: You focus on the hug and for a moment everything feels serene. You hear her heart beating -- or perhaps it's your own.
links.polish: Koncentrujesz się na uścisku i na moment ogarnia cię błogi spokój. Czujesz bicie jej serca. A może to twoje?
links.belarusian: Вы засяроджваецеся на абдымку, і на імгненне ахоплівае вас блажэнны спакой. Вы адчуваеце стук яе сэрца. Ці, можа, гэта ваша?

links.title: Inland Empire: "I wonder how long has it been since..."
links.english: I wonder how long has it been since you last hugged someone?
links.polish: Tak się zastanawiam – ile czasu minęło, od kiedy kogoś ostatnio przytulałeś?
links.belarusian: Я вось думаю — колькі часу мінула, з таго часу, як ты апошні раз кагосьці прытуляў?

links.title: You: "Muscles, I said muscles! I want man..."
links.english: Muscles, I said muscles! I want manly-manly muscles.
links.polish: Mięśnie, powiedziałem. Mięśnie! Chcę niesamowicie męskich mięśni.
links.belarusian: Мышцы, я сказаў. Мышцы! Хачу неверагодна мужчынскія мышцы.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Khm, officer." A coarse female voi..."
links.english: "Khm, officer." A coarse female voice pulls you out of your reverie. "What are you doing?" A swash of water hits the coast behind her figure.
links.polish: „Panie policjancie” – jej chropowaty damski głos wyrywa cię z zadumy. „Co pan robi?” Fala uderza w wybrzeże rozciągające się za jej figurą.
links.belarusian: "Спадарства міліцыянт" — яе шуршавы жаночы голас вырывае цябе з задумення. "Што вы робіце?" Хваля б'е ў бераг, што цягнецца за яе фігурай.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You were eavesdropping on your subc..."
links.english: You were eavesdropping on your subconsciousness.
links.polish: Podsłuchiwałeś swoją własną podświadomość.
links.belarusian: Падслухоўваў сваю ўласную падсвядомасць.

links.title: You: "Do I remember?"
links.english: Do I remember?
links.polish: Czy ja pamiętam?
links.belarusian: Ці я памятаю?

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, you don't. And it's better that..."
links.english: No, you don't. And it's better that way.
links.polish: Nie, nie pamiętasz. I tak jest lepiej.
links.belarusian: Не, не памятаеш. І так лепш.

links.title: You: "What *do* I remember?"
links.english: What *do* I remember?
links.polish: A co *pamiętam*?
links.belarusian: А што *памятаю*?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Nothing."
links.english: Nothing.
links.polish: Nic.
links.belarusian: Нічога.

links.title: Inland Empire: "DON'T COME BACK HERE!"
links.english: DON'T COME BACK HERE!
links.polish: NIE WRACAJ TU JUŻ!
links.belarusian: НЕ ВАРТАЕЦЦА СЮДЫ БОЛЬШ!

links.title: You: "Open your eyes!"
links.english: Open your eyes!
links.polish: Otwórz oczy!
links.belarusian: Адчыні вочы!

links.title: You: "What the fuck was that?"
links.english: What the fuck was that?
links.polish: Co to, kurwa, było?
links.belarusian: Што гэта, халера, было?

links.title: Inland Empire: "OH MY GOD, WHY ARE YOU CALLING ME?..."
links.english: OH MY GOD, WHY ARE YOU CALLING ME? STOP CALLING ME! ARE YOU DRUNK AGAIN?
links.polish: O BOŻE, CZEMU TY DO MNIE DZWONISZ? PRZESTAŃ DO MNIE DZWONIĆ! ZNOWU SIĘ SCHLAŁEŚ?
links.belarusian: О БОЖА, ЧАМУ ТЫ ТЭЛЕФАНУЕШ МНЕ? ПЕРАСТАНЬ МНЕ ТЭЛЕФАНАВАЦЬ! АПЯТЬ НАПІЎСЯ?

links.title: You: "PLEASE OPEN YOUR EYES!"
links.english: PLEASE OPEN YOUR EYES!
links.polish: PROSZĘ, OTWÓRZ OCZY!
links.belarusian: КАЛІ ЛАСКА, АДКРЫЙ ВОЧЫ!

links.title: You: "Keep them closed."
links.english: Keep them closed.
links.polish: Nie otwieraj ich.
links.belarusian: Не адчыняй іх.

links.title: Inland Empire: "I DON'T WANT TO SEE YOU. I DON'T WA..."
links.english: I DON'T WANT TO SEE YOU. I DON'T WANT TO SEE YOU EVER AGAIN! STOP CALLING ME! GET LOST FROM MY LIFE, YOU RUINED IT!
links.polish: NIE CHCĘ CIĘ WIDZIEĆ. NIE CHCĘ CIĘ NIGDY WIĘCEJ OGLĄDAĆ! PRZESTAŃ DO MNIE DZWONIĆ! WYNOŚ SIĘ Z MOJEGO ŻYCIA, ZNISZCZYŁEŚ JE!
links.belarusian: Я НЕ ХАЧУ ЦЯБЕ БАЧЫЦЬ. НЕ ХАЧУ ЦЯБЕ НІКОЛІ БОЛЬШ БАЧЫЦЬ! ПЕРАСТАНЬ МНЕ ТЭЛЕФАНАВАЦЬ! ЗВАЛІСЯ З МАЕГО ЖЫЦЦЯ, ТЫ ЯГО ЗГУБІЎ!

links.title: You: "But I *need* to remember."
links.english: But I *need* to remember.
links.polish: Ale *muszę* sobie przypomnieć.
links.belarusian: Але *павінен* сабе ўспомніць.

links.title: You: "Well, if you say it's better..."
links.english: Well, if you say it's better...
links.polish: No, skoro mówisz, że lepiej...
links.belarusian: Ну, калі кажаш, што лепш...

links.title: Inland Empire: "No thoughts to come back to, no sce..."
links.english: No thoughts to come back to, no scenes to replay.. It feels calm the way deep sleep is supposed to be.
links.polish: Żadnych myśli, do których trzeba wracać, żadnych scen do wspominania. Jest spokój taki, jaki powinien być podczas głębokiego snu.
links.belarusian: Ніякіх думак, да якіх трэба вяртацца, ніякіх сцэн для ўзгадвання. Ёсць спакой такі, якім ён павінен быць падчас глыбокага сну.

links.title: You: "No, please. I don't really want to..."
links.english: No, please. I don't really want to remember.
links.polish: Nie, proszę. Nie chcę sobie tego przypominać.
links.belarusian: Не, калі ласка. Я не хачу гэтага ўспамінаць.

links.title: You: ""I had the strangest... I'm not eve..."
links.english: "I had the strangest... I'm not even sure."
links.polish: „Miałem przedziwną... Nie wiem nawet co”.
links.belarusian: "Я меў дзіўнае... Не ведаю нават што".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""You had the strangest what?" She h..."
links.english: "You had the strangest what?" She hasn't let go of your embrace.
links.polish: „Co takiego pan miał?” – pyta, wciąż pozostając w twoich objęciach.
links.belarusian: "Што ж гэта ў вас было?" – пытаецца яна, застаючыся ў вашых абдымках.

links.title: You: ""A strangest conversation. Somethin..."
links.english: "A strangest conversation. Something went wrong in my head."
links.polish: „Przedziwną rozmowę. Coś poszło nie tak w mojej głowie”.
links.belarusian: "Дзіўную размову. Нешта пайшло не так у маёй галаве".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It's okay. We all feel out of sort..."
links.english: "It's okay. We all feel out of sorts at times." She starts patting your back. "There you go, officer."
links.polish: „Nic się nie stało. Wszyscy czujemy się czasem nieswojo” – zaczyna poklepywać cię po plecach. „Już w porządku, panie policjancie”.
links.belarusian: "Нічога страшнага. Мы ўсе часам адчуваем сябе няўтульна", — пачынае пляскаць цябе па спіне. "Усё ў парадку, пане паліцэйскі".

links.title: Conceptualization: "Today the makeshift consolations: t..."
links.english: Today the makeshift consolations: the shared cigarette, the masculine jokes. Today the embrace before hurting.
links.polish: Dziś to prowizoryczne pocieszenia: wspólny papieros, męskie żarty. Dziś to objęcia przed zranieniem.
links.belarusian: Сёння гэта часовыя суцяшэнні: агульная цыгарэта, мужчынскія жарты. Сёння гэта абдымкі перад болем.

links.title: You: ""It's still happening. I'm in delir..."
links.english: "It's still happening. I'm in delirium."
links.polish: „To się wciąż dzieje. Jestem w delirium”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта ўсё яшчэ адбываецца. Я ў дылерыі".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I'm sorry, I don't really understa..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, I don't really understand what you're talking about." She lets go of your hug.
links.polish: „Przykro mi, ale naprawdę nie rozumiem, o czym pan mówi” – odpowiada i wydostaje się z twojego uścisku.
links.belarusian: "Мне вельмі шкада, але я сапраўды не разумею, пра што вы кажаце", — адказвае ён і вызваляецца з вашых абдымкаў.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks worried. "We c..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks worried. "We can take a break if you're feeling unwell," he says to you under his breath.
links.polish: Porucznik przygląda ci się z niepokojem. „Możemy zrobić przerwę, jeśli nie czujesz się dobrze” – stwierdza szeptem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант уважліва назірае за табой з турботай. "Мы можам зрабіць перапынак, калі ты не адчуваеш сябе добра", — шэптам кажа ён.

links.title: You: ""Something begged me to open my eye..."
links.english: "Something begged me to open my eyes. It was scary."
links.polish: „Coś mnie błagało, żebym otworzył oczy. Straszne to było”.
links.belarusian: "Нешта прасіла мяне, каб я адкрыў вочы. Гэта было страшна".

links.title: You: ""Thanks. I feel better already.""
links.english: "Thanks. I feel better already."
links.polish: „Dziękuję. Już się czuję lepiej”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй. Я ўжо адчуваю сябе лепш".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Good." She lets go of your hug."
links.english: "Good." She lets go of your hug.
links.polish: „To dobrze” – odpowiada i wydostaje się z twojego uścisku.
links.belarusian: "Гэта добра" — адказвае і вызваляецца з твайго абдымкаў.

links.title: You: ""A glitch of a sort, I think. Insid..."
links.english: "A glitch of a sort, I think. Inside my mind."
links.polish: „Chyba jakąś awarię. W swoim umyśle”.
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, нейкая няспраўнасць. У сваім розуме".

links.title: You: ""I don't want to talk about it.""
links.english: "I don't want to talk about it."
links.polish: „Nie chcę o tym rozmawiać”.
links.belarusian: "Я не хачу пра гэта размаўляць".

links.title: You: ""I am fighting for the working clas..."
links.english: "I am fighting for the working class."
links.polish: „Walczę za klasę robotniczą”.
links.belarusian: "Змагаюся за рабочы клас".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Fighting for it how?" She hasn't l..."
links.english: "Fighting for it how?" She hasn't let go of your embrace yet.
links.polish: „Jak pan za nią walczy?” – pyta, wciąż pozostając w twoich objęciach.
links.belarusian: "Як вы за яе змагаецеся?" — пытаецца яна, усё яшчэ застаючыся ў вашых абдымках.

links.title: You: ""Hug-by-hug.""
links.english: "Hug-by-hug."
links.polish: „Przytulaniem”.
links.belarusian: "Абдымкі".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Oh..." There's a strange sensation..."
links.english: "Oh..." There's a strange sensation as the woman strengthens her grip -- she's hugging you back.
links.polish: „Och...” – odczuwasz coś dziwnego, gdy kobieta wzmacnia swój chwyt – ona też cię przytula.
links.belarusian: "Ох..." – адчуваеш нешта дзіўнае, калі жанчына ўзмацняе свой захоп – яна таксама абдымае цябе.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I guess it's better than nothing...."
links.english: "I guess it's better than nothing. Keep fighting on, my fellow comrade." Then she breaks up the hug, her cheeks flushed.
links.polish: „Lepsze to chyba niż nic. Proszę walczyć dalej, towarzyszu” – odpowiada, po czym przerywa uścisk. Na jej policzkach widać rumieńce.
links.belarusian: "Лепш гэта, напэўна, чым нічога. Калі ласка, працягвайце змагацца, таварыш" — адказвае, пасля чаго перарывае абдымкі. На яе шчоках відаць румянец.

links.title: You: ""One hug at a time.""
links.english: "One hug at a time."
links.polish: „Przytulas po przytulasie”.
links.belarusian: "Абдымкі за абдымкамі".

links.title: You: ""A hug a day keeps the bourgeoisie..."
links.english: "A hug a day keeps the bourgeoisie away."
links.polish: „Przytulenie bez okazji – mała klęska burżuazji”.
links.belarusian: "Абдымкі без нагоды — маленькая параза буржуазіі".

links.title: You: ""Hey, I hug whomever I please! I'm..."
links.english: "Hey, I hug whomever I please! I'm a hug monster."
links.polish: „Hej, będę przytulał, kogo chcę! Jestem przytulasowym potworem”.
links.belarusian: "Гэй, буду абдымаць, каго захачу! Я монстр абдымкаў".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""A hug monster? How do these two go..."
links.english: "A hug monster? How do these two go hand-in-hand?" She hasn't let go of your embrace yet.
links.polish: „Przytulasowym potworem? Te słowa w ogóle się ze sobą łączą?” – pyta, wciąż pozostając w twoich objęciach.
links.belarusian: "Прытуласным монстрам? Гэтыя словы наогул спалучаюцца паміж сабой?" – пытаецца яна, яшчэ застаючыся ў тваіх абдымках.

links.title: You: ""They don't. I just forced them thi..."
links.english: "They don't. I just forced them this way. That's why I am a monster."
links.polish: „Nie łączy się. Dokonałem tego powiązania siłą. I dlatego jestem potworem”.
links.belarusian: "Не злучаецца. Я зрабіў гэтую сувязь сілай. І таму я пачвара".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Right, uh..." She pats you on your..."
links.english: "Right, uh..." She pats you on your back, before gently letting go.
links.polish: „Jasne...” – klepie cię po plecach, po czym delikatnie wyswobadza z objęcia.
links.belarusian: "Вядома..." — пляскае цябе па спіне, затым асцярожна вызваляе з абдымкаў.

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Is there anything else I can help..."
links.english: "Is there anything else I can help you with?"
links.polish: „Mogę w czymś jeszcze panu pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я вам яшчэ ў нечым дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""Well, you're not actually entitled..."
links.english: "Well, you're not actually entitled to another person's body. Hugging can be considered a rather monstrous thing to do."
links.polish: „No cóż, nikt nie ma prawa do ciała drugiej osoby. Przytulanie może być więc uznane za coś całkiem potwornego”.
links.belarusian: "Ну што ж, ніхто не мае права на цела іншай асобы. Абдымкі могуць быць, такім чынам, успрыняты як нешта зусім жахлівае".

links.title: You: "Let go."
links.english: Let go.
links.polish: Puść ją.
links.belarusian: Адпусці яе.

links.title: Working Class Woman: "She steps back and returns her atte..."
links.english: She steps back and returns her attention to books, pretending this hug didn't happen.
links.polish: Robi krok w tył i skupia się na książkach, udając, że uścisk nigdy się nie wydarzył.
links.belarusian: Робіць крок назад і засяроджваецца на кнігах, удаючы, што абдымкі ніколі не адбываліся.

links.title: You: ""That's all for the moment. I'll le..."
links.english: "That's all for the moment. I'll let you read." [Leave.]
links.polish: „To na razie wszystko. Pozwolę pani dalej czytać”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "На пакуль гэта ўсё. Пакіну вас чытаць далей". [Сыходзіць].

Alternate1.belarusian: "Дзякуй. У такім разе я ўжо пайду". [Адыдзі].

links.title: Working Class Woman: "The woman before you nods and retur..."
links.english: The woman before you nods and returns to her reading.
links.polish: Kobieta kiwa głową i wraca do czytania.
links.belarusian: Жанчына ківае галавой і вяртаецца да чытання.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still browsi..."
dialogueTree.polish: „Hmm... Hmm... Hmm” – mamrocze, wciąż przeglądając książki.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Гмм... Гмм... Гмм" – бурмоча, працягваючы гартаць кнігі.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Сыходзь].

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: "She's still browsing books."

links.title: You: ""I'm a policeman.""
links.english: "I'm a policeman."
links.polish: „Jestem policjantem”.
links.belarusian: "Я міліцыянер".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""I know you are.""
links.english: "I know you are."
links.polish: „Wiem, że pan nim jest”.
links.belarusian: "Я ведаю, што вы ім з'яўляецеся".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everyone can see that. The rectang..."
links.english: "Everyone can see that. The rectangles." He points to his sleeve.
links.polish: „Wszyscy to widzą. Prostokąty” – wskazuje na swój rękaw.
links.belarusian: "Усе гэта бачаць. Прастакутнікі", – паказвае на свой рукаў.

links.title: You: ""Good then.""
links.english: "Good then."
links.polish: „To dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта добра".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Mhm." She reverts her attention to..."
links.english: "Mhm." She reverts her attention to the soggy books on the book stand.
links.polish: „Mhm” – wraca do przeglądania wilgotnych książek.
links.belarusian: "Мгм" — вяртаецца да прагляду вільготных кніг.

links.title: You: ""Do you need the help of a policema..."
links.english: "Do you need the help of a policeman?"
links.polish: „Potrzebuje pani pomocy policjanta?”
links.belarusian: "Вам патрэбна дапамога паліцэйскага?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""What with?" She tries hard to focu..."
links.english: "What with?" She tries hard to focus on the book stand.
links.polish: „Z czym?” – pyta, próbując skupić się na książkach.
links.belarusian: "З чым?" — пытаецца ён, стараючыся засяродзіцца на кнігах.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "What *with*? A lot of things! For e..."
links.english: What *with*? A lot of things! For example, people tend to go *missing*.
links.polish: Z *czym*? Z mnóstwem rzeczy! Zdarza się na przykład, że dochodzi do *zaginięć*.
links.belarusian: З *чым*? З вялікай колькасцю рэчаў! Бывае, што адбываюцца *знікненні*.

links.title: Authority: "This citizen thinks she can do with..."
links.english: This citizen thinks she can do without your assistance? Don't buy it. They all need help.
links.polish: Ta obywatelka sądzi, że poradzi sobie bez twojej pomocy? Nie wierz w to. Wszyscy jej potrzebują.
links.belarusian: Та грамадзянка лічыць, што справіцца без тваёй дапамогі? Не вер у гэта. Усім яна патрэбная.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Help her by... carrying things? Uhm..."
links.english: Help her by... carrying things? Uhm... maybe she needs a weightlifter? Maybe she needs you to *fight* her husband? No, that's not it...
links.polish: Pomóż jej... nosząc jakieś rzeczy? Albo... może potrzebuje ciężarowca? Albo kogoś, kto *pobije* się z jej mężem? Nie, chyba nie...
links.belarusian: Памажы ёй... насіць нейкія рэчы? Ці... можа, ёй патрэбны цяжкавагавік? Ці нехта, хто *паб'ецца* з яе мужам? Не, напэўна, не...

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Сыходзь].

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Адыдзі].

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still browsi..."
dialogueTree.polish: „Hmm... Hmm... Hmm” – mamrocze, wciąż przeglądając książki.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Гм... Гм... Гм" — мармоча ён, усё яшчэ праглядаючы кнігі.

links.title: You: ""Shouldn't a working class woman be..."
links.english: "Shouldn't a working class woman be working?"
links.polish: „Czy kobieta z klasy robotniczej nie powinna pracować?”
links.belarusian: "Ці не павінна жанчына з рабочага класа працаваць?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Not all the time. Right now I'm br..."
links.english: "Not all the time. Right now I'm browsing books." She pauses. "Even a working class woman needs something to read."
links.polish: „Nie przez cały czas. W tej chwili przeglądam książki” – mówi, po czym na chwilę przerywa. „Nawet przedstawicielka klasy robotniczej potrzebuje czegoś do czytania”.
links.belarusian: "Не ўвесь час. Зараз я праглядаю кнігі", — кажа яна, пасля чаго на хвіліну прыпыняецца. "Нават прадстаўніца рабочага класа патрэбна мае нешта для чытання".

links.title: You: ""Phenomenal.""
links.english: "Phenomenal."
links.polish: „To przewspaniale”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта выдатна".

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""It is.""
links.english: "It is."
links.polish: „Zgadza się”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды".

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""Good, good." (Nod.)"
links.english: "Good, good." (Nod.)
links.polish: „Świetnie, świetnie”. (Skiń głową).
links.belarusian: "Цудоўна, цудоўна". (Кіўні галавой).

links.title: You: ""I'm a policeman.""
links.english: "I'm a policeman."
links.polish: „Jestem policjantem”.
links.belarusian: "Я міліцыянер".

links.title: You: ""What are you doing?""
links.english: "What are you doing?"
links.polish: „Co pani robi?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы робіце?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Looking for something to read." Sh..."
links.english: "Looking for something to read." She reverts her attention to a worn out paperback.
links.polish: „Szukam czegoś do czytania” – odpowiada i znowu skupia swoją uwagę na sfatygowanej książce w miękkiej okładce.
links.belarusian: "Шукаю нешта для чытання", — адказвае і зноў засяроджвае сваю ўвагу на зношанай кнізе ў мяккай вокладцы.

links.title: You: ""Have a good day." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Have a good day." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Miłego dnia”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Прыемнага дня". [Адыходзь].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This was a tremendously useful int..."
links.english: "This was a tremendously useful interlude."
links.polish: „To było wyjątkowo przydatne interludium”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта была надзвычай карысная інтэрлюдыя".

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still mumbli..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hmm-hmm-hmm..." She's still mumbling to herself, now reading another paperback.
dialogueTree.polish: „Hmm... Hmm... Hmm” – mamrocze do siebie, czytając kolejną książkę w miękkiej okładce.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Гм... Гм... Гм", — бурмоча сам сабе, чытаючы чарговую кнігу ў мяккай вокладцы.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hmm-hmm-hmm." You see a sturdy wom..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hmm-hmm-hmm." You see a sturdy woman humming to herself. She seems to be browsing books.
dialogueTree.polish: „Hmm... Hmm... Hmm” – krzepka kobieta mamrocze do siebie. Zdaje się, że przegląda książki.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Гм... Гм... Гм," — крапкая жанчына мармыча сабе пад нос. Здаецца, яна прагледжвае кнігі.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): ""The ship takes off like a silvery..."
links.english: "The ship takes off like a silvery mosquito... unfolding its rotor blade arms..." She mumbles reading. Then puts down the softcover.
links.polish: „Okręt wznosi się niczym srebrzysty komar... rozwija swe wirnikowe skrzydła...” – mamrocze pod nosem, gdy czyta. Po chwili odkłada książkę.
links.belarusian: "Карабель уздымаецца, як срэбрысты камар... разгортвае свае вірнікавыя крылы..." – мармыча сабе пад нос, калі чытае. Праз хвіліну адкладае кнігу.

links.title: You: ""Is that "Loos, Radio City" you're..."
links.english: "Is that "Loos, Radio City" you're reading?"
links.polish: „Czy pani czyta »Loos, radiowe miasto«?”
links.belarusian: "Ці вы чытаеце "Лос, радыёгарад"?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes, a sci-fi," she says without r..."
links.english: "Yes, a sci-fi," she says without reverting her attention from the book.
links.polish: „Tak, fantastyka naukowa” – odpowiada bez odrywania wzroku od książki.
links.belarusian: "Так, навукова-фантастычная літаратура", – адказвае ён, не адрываючы вачэй ад кнігі.

links.title: You: ""Who are you?""
links.english: "Who are you?"
links.polish: „Kim pani jest?”
links.belarusian: "Хто вы, спадарыня?"

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Me?" She looks up briefly. "No one..."
links.english: "Me?" She looks up briefly. "No one, I'm just a working class woman."
links.polish: „Ja?” – spogląda na ciebie krótko. „Nikim, zwykłą kobietą z klasy robotniczej”.
links.belarusian: "Я?" — коратка зіркае на цябе. "Нікім, звычайнай жанчынай з рабочага класа".

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't really want to be distu..."
links.english: She doesn't really want to be disturbed that much...
links.polish: Naprawdę nie chce, żeby tak bardzo jej przeszkadzano...
links.belarusian: Сапраўды не хоча, каб ёй так моцна перашкаджалі...

links.title: Logic: "If she's such a *working class* wom..."
links.english: If she's such a *working class* woman, why isn't she working?
links.polish: Skoro to kobieta *z klasy robotniczej*, to czemu nie pracuje?
links.belarusian: Калі яна жанчына *з працоўнага класа*, то чаму не працуе?

links.title: You: ""A good one?" (Point at the book.)"
links.english: "A good one?" (Point at the book.)
links.polish: „Dobra lektura?” (Wskaż na książkę).
links.belarusian: "Добрая чытанка?" (Пакажыце на кнігу).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Yes, hello." She nods, her attenti..."
links.english: "Yes, hello." She nods, her attention fully focused on reading.
links.polish: „Tak, dzień dobry” – odpowiada, kiwając głową. Jej uwagę pochłania czytana książka.
links.belarusian: "Так, добры дзень", — адказвае яна, ківаючы галавой. Яе ўвагу паглынула кніга, якую яна чытае.

links.title: You: ""Hello." (No ceremonies. Just hello..."
links.english: "Hello." (No ceremonies. Just hello.)
links.polish: „Witam”. (Bez zbędnych konwenansów. Witasz i już).
links.belarusian: "Вітаю". (Без лішніх фармальнасцей. Вітаеш і ўжо).

links.title: Working Class Woman: ""Hello." She nods, her attention fu..."
links.english: "Hello." She nods, her attention fully focused on reading.
links.polish: „Witam” – odpowiada, kiwając głową. Jej uwagę pochłania czytana książka.
links.belarusian: "Вітаю", – адказвае яна, ківаючы галавой. Яе ўвагу паглынае кніга, якую яна чытае.

links.title: You: "[Leave her be.]"
links.english: [Leave her be.]
links.polish: [Zostaw ją w spokoju].
links.belarusian: [Пакінь яе ў спакоі].
